Title: CX Coordinator
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
About Us
Step into the wild world of OneDayOnly – South Africa's OG daily deals hub. We're the pioneers of cool discounts, hitting you for just one day because, well, why overcomplicate things? We've got the big names, top suppliers, and a dash of our secret sauce to make you feel like a BIG DEAL. Not to brag, but we have over a million potential savvy shoppers getting our daily dose every 24 hours.
We're not fussy – if the price is right and the quality checks out, we're selling it. That's what makes us the go-to for both the smart buyer and the eager seller. Toss in the urgency of our deals, and boom, success happens quicker than you can blink. So, jump in, where FOMO meets killer deals, and let's turn every day into a retail party!
About You
The Customer Experience (CX) Coordinator supports the Head of Customer Experience in ensuring OneDayOnly delivers a seamless, fun, and customer-first shopping experience.
This role provides essential coordination, reporting, and research support across CX initiatives - from tracking customer feedback and compiling insights, to helping manage key journeys and assisting with brand-aligned communication.
It’s a hands-on, learning-focused position suited to someone organised, curious, and eager to grow in the world of customer experience, marketing, and brand.
Responsibilities
CX Administration & Coordination
Coordinate and track day-to-day CX activities and projects to ensure smooth delivery.
Support the Head of CX with project timelines, action lists, meeting preparation, and stakeholder follow-ups.
Maintain CX documentation, dashboards, and research libraries so insights are easily accessible to the wider business.
Assist in ensuring consistent communication and collaboration across departments such as Marketing, Customer Service, and Development.
Reporting & Data Support
Collect and compile customer experience metrics (e.g. NPS, CSAT, feedback surveys) for reporting and analysis.
Maintain CX dashboards and assist in identifying key insights or recurring trends.
Highlight notable shifts or opportunities from customer data to help inform CX or marketing decisions.
Research & Insights Support
Assist in the coordination of customer and market research projects.
Gather and organise qualitative and quantitative insights to support customer understanding.
Summarise findings into clear, usable insights for internal teams.
CRM & Journey Support
Assist in coordinating transactional, abandoned cart, and other customer journey communications in partnership with the CRM team.
Review messaging and touchpoints for alignment with CX strategy and tone of voice.
Support testing, feedback, and reporting for these journeys to ensure ongoing optimisation.
CX Alignment for Development Projects
Support the Head of CX in ensuring customer experience is considered in development projects (e.g., Guest Checkout, Courier Integration, XTD).
Coordinate inputs, track progress, and document CX feedback throughout the project lifecycle.
Help ensure UI, communication, and journey elements remain aligned with customer needs.
Brand & Marketing Support
Help coordinate CX and brand-led campaigns, ensuring messaging aligns with OneDayOnly’s tone and customer promise.
Support in tracking and reporting the customer impact of brand or marketing activities.
Experience And Qualifications
Minimum 2–3 years of experience in Marketing, or project management, preferably within e-commerce, media, or retail.
Exceptional attention to detail and analytical skills. You must feel completely at home working with spreadsheets, data and numbers.
Ability to compile reports and communicate results.
Strong organisational and time-management skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite or Google Workspace.
Good understanding of marketing, analytics, and performance measurement, with interest in customers, brand, and digital experiences.
Proactive, curious, and willing to learn new tools and concepts.
A collaborative and dependable team player.
A relevant Bachelor’s degree with a specific focus on Marketing or Commerce.
A genuine appreciation for the OneDayOnly brand and sense of humour.
Values
Challenge Accepted: We create bold campaigns, own our results, and push creative boundaries to make an impact.
Solve Smart: We use insights, data, and innovation to solve marketing challenges creatively and effectively.
Character Counts: We communicate honestly, ethically, and with creativity, building trust with customers and colleagues.
Customer Obsessed: We deeply understand our audience, delivering content and campaigns that resonate and drive action.
Seriously Unserious: We bring enthusiasm, wit, and fun to our campaigns and teamwork, while staying results-focused.

Title: Professional Civil Engineer
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Description
Zutari: Co-creating an engineered impact.
Zutari is a well-established, management-owned engineering firm with almost 90 years' experience. As human-centred engineering consultants and advisors, we are trusted by our clients, business partners, communities and other stakeholders across Africa.
We co-create engineering solutions that have a positive impact and improve people's lives. Zutari values inclusion and recognises the importance of a diverse, talented workforce, believing that people need other people to succeed.
What kind of talent do we pursue?
We employ people with the right attitude and a positive mindset, who are motivated by doing the right thing, getting things done and share a sense of urgency. People who have an impact in our teams and broader community. People who think differently and connect with those around them to co-create new opportunities and leave a meaningful legacy.
Role Responsibilities
A solid background in public and private sector land infrastructure projects from township to site specific scale.
Knowledge and experience of working with relevant engineering codes, standards, and practices.
Advanced computer skills with demonstrated proficiency in using CAD Software.
Sound knowledge in the use of a variety of civil engineering analysis software such as PCSWMM, Civil Designer, Civil 3D, Wadiso etc.
General understanding of BIM processes.
Work winning, client facing capability and experience.
Assist in preparing and coordinating tenders/bids and contribute to winning work initiatives.
Establish a clear understanding of project goals and stakeholder expectations, specifically managing client expectations and ensuring that delivery meets expectations.
Lead design teams in project delivery.
Produce key deliverables such as technical reports, specifications, and bills of quantities.
Act as a senior project-level point of contact for clients.
Resolve project level issues independently.
Motivate the project team towards the determined objectives by generating enthusiasm for the project and by maintaining a continued personal interest in achieving set targets.
A team player that is willing to collaborate across multiple disciplines and international geographies.
Mentor junior engineers.
Confident, well-spoken, disciplined, detail and deadline / delivery orientated.
Excellent communication skills (proven ability to interact well with personnel at all organizational levels)
Excellent organisational skills (ability to plan and implement) and time management skills.
Minimum Requirements
BSc/BEng Degree or B Tech (Civil Engineering).
Professional Engineer registered with ECSA
Minimum of 8 years’ experience as a design specialist in land infrastructure, specific to municipal and site specific services.
Must be CAD proficient.
Civil 3D (advantageous)
We believe that a diverse workforce is key to our business success. We seek the best people for our jobs based on their skills, qualifications, and experience. We embrace the principle of equal opportunity in employment, and we work towards eliminating all forms of unlawful discrimination in our employment practices. In support of diversity and the equal opportunity principle, preference will be given to individuals from designated groups within South Africa.

Title: Immobilier commercial
Description:
🏢 OFFRE D’EMPLOI – COMMERCIAL IMMOBILIER (H/F)
📍 Basé(e) à Abidjan – Côte d’Ivoire
Entreprise : Najayna Experts
🌟 À propos de nous
Najayna Experts est une entreprise spécialisée dans l’immobilier, la gestion locative, le nettoyage professionnel et la construction.
Notre mission : offrir à chaque client — propriétaire, investisseur ou entreprise — des solutions globales et sur mesure, alliant rigueur, performance et excellence de service.
Nous valorisons les biens et les projets immobiliers avec une approche haut de gamme fondée sur la confiance, la transparence et la rentabilité.
🎯 Missions principales
1. Prospection et développement commercial
• Identifier et qualifier les prospects : propriétaires, promoteurs, entreprises de construction, syndics, agences et investisseurs.
• Élaborer et exécuter des plans de prospection ciblés (terrain, phoning, e-mailing, réseaux professionnels, événements).
• Construire des argumentaires efficaces pour les offres immobilières, de gestion locative, de nettoyage professionnel et de construction.
• Développer un réseau relationnel solide et durable avec les acteurs clés du secteur immobilier et BTP.
2. Gestion du cycle de vente complet
• Analyser les besoins spécifiques de chaque client et proposer des solutions sur mesure.
• Rédiger des offres commerciales claires et compétitives adaptées aux différents services proposés.
• Mener les négociations commerciales dans le respect des marges et de la politique commerciale de Najayna Experts.
• Gérer la contractualisation et le suivi administratif des dossiers clients (location, gestion, nettoyage, etc.)
3. Suivi et fidélisation client
• Assurer une communication fluide entre les clients et les équipes internes (planning, coordination , retour d’intervention)
• Garantir la qualité de service à chaque étape du processus via des visites de contrôle et retours d’expérience.
• Mettre en place des actions de fidélisation et de relance commerciale (offres, suivi personnalisé, enquêtes de satisfaction).
• Faire remonter les observations du terrain à la direction pour optimiser les offres et les services.
4. Reporting et pilotage commercial
• Suivre les indicateurs clés de performance (CA, taux de conversion, marges, satisfaction client).
• Assurer un reporting régulier (hebdomadaire/mensuel) auprès de la direction commerciale.
• Contribuer à la stratégie de développement en apportant un retour terrain pertinent et constructif.
👤 Profil recherché
Formation :
• Bac +2/3 minimum en Commerce, Marketing, Immobilier ou domaine équivalent.
Expérience :
• Minimum 2 ans d’expérience dans la vente, la prospection commerciale ou la gestion immobilière, idéalement dans un environnement haut de gamme.
Compétences clés :
• Excellente présentation et sens aigu du contact client.
• Esprit commercial et goût du challenge.
• Organisation, autonomie et rigueur.
• Bonne connaissance du marché immobilier à Abidjan.
• Maîtrise des outils digitaux et des réseaux sociaux professionnels (WhatsApp Business, LinkedIn, Instagram…).
🚗 Permis de conduire B obligatoire (déplacements fréquents pour visites et rendez-vous).
Disponibilité : Immédiate
Envoyez votre CV et lettre de motivation (précisant votre disponibilité immédiate et vos prétentions salariales) à :
👉 bmc@najaynaexperts.com
Objet du mail : « Candidature – Commercial(e) Najayna Experts »

Title: Comptable
Description:
Offre – Comptable Confirmé(e)
Localisation : Burkina Faso
Type de contrat : CDI – Temps plein
Rattachement hiérarchique
• Cheffe Comptable Groupe
• DAF Groupe
• Filiale Burkina Faso – Groupe BOX AFRICA
Contexte
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses équipes financières et de la structuration progressive de ses filiales, BOX AFRICA déploie une organisation comptable harmonisée, conforme au SYSCOHADA révisé ainsi qu’aux dispositions fiscales et sociales de chaque pays d’implantation.
La filiale du Burkina Faso connaît une montée en régime de ses opérations commerciales, administratives et financières, nécessitant une comptabilité fiable, des déclarations fiscales et sociales maîtrisées, une trésorerie suivie avec précision et une information financière de qualité.
Pour accompagner cette dynamique et compléter l’équipe comptable déjà en place, BOX AFRICA recherche un(e) Comptable Confirmé(e) qui viendra renforcer le dispositif existant. Au sein de cette équipe, il/elle sera chargé(e) d’assurer l’intégralité de la comptabilité courante, la révision, la fiscalité, la paie et la trésorerie opérationnelle, avec un bon niveau d’autonomie, tout en travaillant en coordination étroite avec la Cheffe Comptable Groupe et le DAF Groupe.
Mission
Assurer la tenue fiable de la comptabilité générale et auxiliaire, garantir la conformité fiscale et sociale, piloter les opérations quotidiennes de trésorerie, produire une information financière régulière et contribuer à la qualité des processus comptables de la filiale.
Responsabilités clés
1. Comptabilité générale & auxiliaire
• Assurer la saisie, le contrôle et l’imputation des opérations courantes (achats, ventes, banques, caisses, salaires, opérations diverses) conformément au SYSCOHADA révisé.
• Suivre et lettrer les comptes tiers : clients, fournisseurs, comptes rattachés, personnel.
• Gérer et suivre les immobilisations (entrées, sorties, amortissements).
• Participer à la mise à jour des procédures comptables (classement, archivage, validation des pièces, circuits de validation).
2. Révision & clôture des comptes
• Préparer et réaliser la révision périodique (mensuelle, trimestrielle, annuelle).
○
analyse des soldes, justification des comptes, écritures de régularisation.
• Préparer les situations comptables et reportings destinés à la Cheffe Comptable Groupe / DAF Groupe.
• Participer au bilan et au compte de résultat avec la Cheffe Comptable Groupe, l’expert-comptable et le commissaire aux comptes.
• Contribuer aux travaux de clôture annuelle (dossiers de travail, revues, annexes).
3. Fiscalité burkinabè
• Établir et déposer les déclarations fiscales dans les délais :
TVA, IS, acomptes, retenues à la source, taxes sur salaires, autres impôts.
• Assurer le paiement des impôts et taxes en coordination avec la trésorerie.
• Tenir un échéancier fiscal et alerter sur les risques de retard.
• Préparer les dossiers en cas de contrôle ou de demande de l’administration fiscale.
4. Social & Paie
• Préparer et/ou saisir les éléments variables de paie (absences, primes, indemnités, avances).
• Participer à l’élaboration des bulletins (interne ou prestataire externe).
• Établir les déclarations sociales et suivre les paiements.
• Assurer l’archivage des dossiers du personnel du point de vue comptable et social.
5. Trésorerie & relations bancaires
• Réaliser les rapprochements bancaires réguliers et analyser les écarts.
• Suivre quotidiennement la trésorerie (banque, caisse) et alerter en cas d’anomalies.
• Gérer la caisse :
mouvements, justificatifs, suivi des avances.
• Participer à la préparation des prévisions de trésorerie (échéances majeures).
• Gérer la relation opérationnelle avec les banques :
remises, virements, relevés, RIB, moyens de paiement.
• Appliquer les règles et procédures de trésorerie du Groupe et remonter les informations requises.
6. Relation avec les tiers & support au pilotage
• Être l’interlocuteur comptable de premier niveau auprès de :
○ l’expert-comptable,
○ le commissaire aux comptes,
○ les administrations fiscales et sociales,
○ les banques.
• Contribuer à la production des reportings Groupe.
• Proposer des améliorations sur les processus comptables, fiscaux et de trésorerie.
Périmètre technique
• Maîtrise du SYSCOHADA révisé.
• Connaissance de la fiscalité burkinabè.
• Base solide en paie et déclarations sociales.
• Trésorerie opérationnelle : rapprochements, caisse, échéances.
• Maîtrise d’un logiciel comptable / ERP (Sage, Odoo ou équivalent).
• Maîtrise d’Excel (tableaux, formules de base).
• Très bonne capacité d’analyse et de justification des comptes.
Profil recherché
Formation
• Bac+4 minimum en Comptabilité, Finance, Gestion, Techniques Comptables et Financières ou équivalent.
Expérience
• 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en comptabilité générale, idéalement :
○ en cabinet comptable,
○ et/ou en entreprise structurée avec exposition à la révision, fiscalité, paie et trésorerie.
Compétences clés
• Rigueur, sens du détail et fiabilité.
• Autonomie en comptabilité, fiscalité, paie et trésorerie.
• Capacité à travailler sous pression, notamment lors des clôtures et échéances.
• Gestion multi-tâches et priorisation.
• Bon relationnel interne et externe.
• Intégrité et confidentialité.
• Esprit d’amélioration continue.
Plus qui font la différence
• Connaissance approfondie du SYSCOHADA et de la fiscalité locale.
• Aisance dans un environnement multi-filiales et multi-interlocuteurs.
• Capacité à structurer, sécuriser et fiabiliser les processus.
Pourquoi rejoindre BOX AFRICA ?
• Une montée en compétences rapide dans un groupe régional structuré.
• Une exposition directe aux équipes financières Groupe.
• Une fonction clé pour la fiabilité financière de la filiale.
• Un environnement exigeant offrant de vraies perspectives d’évolution.

Title: People Analytics Analyst
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
About The Role
We’re looking for a People Analytics Analyst who can turn workforce data into insights that guide smarter decisions across Recruitment, Customer Success, Team Operations, and the broader organization. If analyzing people trends, optimizing hiring funnels, and building models that help leaders plan ahead sound exciting to you, this role could be a great fit.
What You'll Do
Workforce and Performance Insights: Track capacity, productivity, pass rates, and staffing trends across internal departments; analyze workload distribution to identify when teams need additional support; provide recommendations based on people data to improve efficiency and staffing alignment.
Forecasting and Predictive Models: Build forecasting models for attrition, staffing needs, and hiring demand; create scenario plans for seasonal changes, service expansions, and operational shifts; present data-backed options that support leadership decision-making.
Recruitment Funnel Analytics: Review recruitment metrics such as application flow, pass rates, and interview-to-hire ratios; strengthen forecasting for applicant supply and expected hiring volume; suggest improvements to workflows and funnel efficiency.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop dashboards and reports for Recruitment, Sales, CS, and Ops; prepare monthly workforce and people insights for leadership; ensure consistent and accurate views of people data across teams.
Data Governance and AI Support: Partner with Engineering and Data Management to maintain data accuracy; support AI-based tools such as health scores, bandwidth scores, and internal dashboards; identify and resolve gaps in data collection and structure.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Statistics, Business, or related fields
5+ years in people analytics, workforce analytics, HR analytics, or similar roles
Strong quantitative and modeling skills
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets proficiency
Experience in BPO, outsourcing, HR, or high-volume recruitment environments is preferred
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and a backup plan or backup workspace

Competitive pay with annual performance-based increases
Paid time off so you can rest and recharge
Health and dental insurance or a health stipend to make you feel your best
Comprehensive health and dental insurance

Title: Financial Systems Functional Analyst
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Company Description
RBG Applications
Job Title: Financial Systems Functional Analyst
The purpose of this role is to ensure that efficient, cost-effective business solutions and processes are in place to address business needs/requirements within the financial services sector. The role facilitates effective and competitive business processes by eliciting, analysing, validating, and documenting business, organisational, and/or operational requirements related to financial transactions, payment systems, and banking processes.
As a
Financial Systems Functional Analyst
, you will act as a bridge between the business unit, organisational stakeholders, and the solution team, focusing specifically on financial systems, such as debit card implementation/transactions, EFT out, PayShap, and other digital payment solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Requirements Elicitation & Documentation:
Gather and document business requirements specific to financial transaction systems, such as debit card processing, EFT (Electronic Funds Transfer) transactions, and real-time payment platforms like PayShap. Ensure these requirements meet the needs of business units, including regulatory compliance and financial security standards.
System Design & Configuration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including system designers and solution architects, to co-create sustainable financial solutions, such as automated EFT processing, secure debit card implementation/transactions, and integration with digital payment platforms like PayShap.
Business Process Optimisation:
Analyse existing financial processes related to debit card management, EFT outflows, and payments to identify areas for improvement and implement solutions that increase efficiency and reduce costs.
Testing & Validation:
Lead the testing and validation of low to medium complexity financial applications, ensuring that systems related to debit card implementation/transactions, EFT, and digital payment methods like PayShap are accurate, reliable, and meet both business and regulatory requirements.
Stakeholder Communication:
Serve as the primary point of contact between business stakeholders, including financial teams, and the solution team. Translate business needs into technical specifications for financial systems, ensuring alignment between all parties.
Compliance & Security:
Ensure that all financial systems and processes, such as debit card systems and EFT transactions, adhere to industry standards, security protocols, and regulatory requirements (e.g., PCI-DSS, AML, KYC).
Continuous Improvement:
Contribute to ongoing improvements in banking and payment systems by identifying and implementing process efficiencies and emerging technologies in the banking and financial services sector.
Required Skills & Experience:
Proven experience in banking, financial services, or payment systems analysis, specifically with systems like debit card implementation and transactions, EFT flows, and products like PayShap or similar payment platforms.
Strong expertise in business analysis and process optimisation within the financial services industry, particularly focusing on transaction management and digital payment solutions.
Specialised knowledge in systems analysis, including the creation, configuration, and testing of low to medium complexity applications for financial services.
Strong understanding of financial regulations, including compliance with PCI-DSS, AML (Anti-Money Laundering), KYC (Know Your Customer), and other industry standards.
Experience with integrating and optimising financial systems, including transaction processing systems, payment gateways, and EFT solutions.
Proficiency in using financial software platforms, transaction management systems, and banking applications.
Excellent analytical skills and ability to understand complex financial business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with agile methodologies and financial solution development processes.
Experience with testing and validating financial applications or payment system integrations.
Knowledge of emerging payment technologies and trends within the banking and financial sector.
Relevant certifications in financial systems analysis or banking operations.

Delivering solutions that are Fit for Purpose
Dedicating themselves to Building a Sustainable Legacy
Taking Responsibility and being Accountable

Cultivating strong and meaningful Partnerships
Reporting to the
Coordinator – Production Geology
, you will be responsible for coordination and ore control activities to ensure optimal feed grade material is delivered to the process plant. All work programs are to be implemented consistently with sound world operating principles as well as optimizing the financial objectives of the business.
Your duties will include but are not limited to the following:
Ensure all production reconciliations (mineable block to model (GCO), ore block planned to actual, crusher feed to plant, etc.) are being carried out on a daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis and disseminated to all designated personnel and the appropriate actions are being taken to rectify any reconciliation issues.
Keep open and clear communication channels with the metallurgists’ engineers to ensure ore characteristic information i.e. grade, hardness, recovery, upgrade factors, etc. for feed material is being shared to improve recoveries and throughputs.
Manage dilution, ore loss, and material misclassification.
Provide dispatch with clear instructions on the correct material type and destination.
Assist to ensure all production reconciliations (mineable block to model (GCO), ore block planned to actual, crusher feed to plant, etc.) are being carried on a daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis and disseminated to all designated personnel. The appropriate actions are being taken to rectify any reconciliation issues.
Ensure the mined ore blocks and the material fed to the crusher are accurately tracked and recorded in a timely manner.
Monitor ore movements from different mining areas (e.g., pits, stockpiles, ROM pads) to ensure the correct blend of ore types is delivered to the mill.
Work closely with mine planning and Metallurgists to define daily, weekly, and monthly feed blend targets.
Vulcan block model is being correctly flagged and updated with mineable blocks at the end of each month. Know how to evaluate and report mineable blocks against the reserve model and report.
Track and report broken and in-situ ore stocks.
Provide input or feedback to daily, weekly and monthly production schedules.
Encourage teamwork and adopt management philosophy to keep personnel motivated, and producing a high standard of work
To be considered for the position, you must meet the following requirements:
Full Grade Twelve (12) School Certificate
Bachelor’s Degree in Geology or Equivalent
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar role; mining geology associated with large open cut mines.
Member of The Engineering Institution of Zambia (EIZ).
Experience in supervising production/ ore control teams.
Must have extensive, current knowledge of mining in large open cut mines with associated knowledge in management principles and philosophies.
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills in the English language.
Must be computer literate with knowledge of 3D mining software & Microsoft Office.
Be physically fit and able to pass pre-employment medical.
Must have a current Zambian driving license.
What We Can Offer You
A comprehensive compensation package including bonuses and site-specific benefits.
The ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to grow and learn with industry colleagues.
Access to a variety of career opportunities across the organisation

En Afrique francophone

En tant que firme multidisciplinaire, Deloitte offre à ses clients un accompagnement de proximité et sur mesure grâce à la maîtrise des enjeux locaux afin de répondre aux attentes et aux besoins des acteurs publics et privés (Banques, Assurances, Technologies Médias Télécoms, Santé, Consumer Business, Energie …).
Quel sera votre rôle ?
En accompagnant nos équipes d'Auditeurs, vous participez à des missions ayant pour objectif de piloter et coordonner l’audit interne ou externe afin de garantir la qualité et la conformité des travaux réalisés par l’équipe. Dans ce cadre, vous serez amené(e) à :
Effectuer les Revues indépendantes de dossiers cotés et/ou sensibles.
Assurer le suivi permanent des dossiers confiés en revue indépendante : intervention auprès des équipes à toutes étapes clés de la mission, depuis les réunions de planification jusqu’à l’émission des rapports.
Suivre le coaching des équipes d’audit sur la méthodologie d’audit
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre les outils de monitoring de Revues indépendantes
Etablir des reporting de qualité
Participer à l’élaboration de plans d’actions thématiques (formations, communications, propositions, d’évolutions méthodologique) en lien avec les constats issus de vos travaux.
Veiller à la professionnalisation de la Revue indépendante (ainsi que le processus d’améliorations continue qui s’en suivra)
En rejoignant Deloitte, vous serez formé(e) à nos méthodologies et aurez l'opportunité de travailler au sein d'équipes pluridisciplinaires et internationales. Vous aurez l'opportunité de développer un set de compétences, partagé avec notre réseau international, et structuré autour des dimensions suivantes : leadership, métier et spécialité. Grâce aux missions variées auxquelles vous participerez et au programme de formations proposé, vous pourrez renforcer progressivement ces compétences, en acquérir de nouvelles et progresser ainsi au sein de notre firme.
Et si c'était vous
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'une grande école de commerce ou de formation universitaire, vous disposez idéalement d'un 3ème cycle ou d'une spécialisation en audit/comptabilité/finance, idéalement DSCG ou DEC.
Vous souhaitez valoriser une expérience de 5 à 6 ans dans le secteur de l’industrie, de l'audit externe, (idéalement dans un Big 4) ou d’une expérience en supervision, de contrôle qualité
Vous êtes doté(e) de très bonnes capacités rédactionnelles et de synthèse
Vous avez une forte appétence pour les sujets techniques et méthodologiques et d’une expérience des dossiers cotés.
Vous avez une bonne aisance dans l’organisation des projets et le « multitasking »
Vous avez une bonne aisance relationnelle et pédagogue
Une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais (oral, écrit) est demandée

Title: People Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role
We’re looking for a People Analytics Analyst who can turn workforce data into insights that guide smarter decisions across Recruitment, Customer Success, Team Operations, and the broader organization. If analyzing people trends, optimizing hiring funnels, and building models that help leaders plan ahead sound exciting to you, this role could be a great fit.
What You'll Do
Workforce and Performance Insights: Track capacity, productivity, pass rates, and staffing trends across internal departments; analyze workload distribution to identify when teams need additional support; provide recommendations based on people data to improve efficiency and staffing alignment.
Forecasting and Predictive Models: Build forecasting models for attrition, staffing needs, and hiring demand; create scenario plans for seasonal changes, service expansions, and operational shifts; present data-backed options that support leadership decision-making.
Recruitment Funnel Analytics: Review recruitment metrics such as application flow, pass rates, and interview-to-hire ratios; strengthen forecasting for applicant supply and expected hiring volume; suggest improvements to workflows and funnel efficiency.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop dashboards and reports for Recruitment, Sales, CS, and Ops; prepare monthly workforce and people insights for leadership; ensure consistent and accurate views of people data across teams.
Data Governance and AI Support: Partner with Engineering and Data Management to maintain data accuracy; support AI-based tools such as health scores, bandwidth scores, and internal dashboards; identify and resolve gaps in data collection and structure.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Statistics, Business, or related fields
5+ years in people analytics, workforce analytics, HR analytics, or similar roles
Strong quantitative and modeling skills
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets proficiency
Experience in BPO, outsourcing, HR, or high-volume recruitment environments is preferred
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and a backup plan or backup workspace
Perks and Benefits
Competitive pay with annual performance-based increases
Paid time off so you can rest and recharge
Health and dental insurance or a health stipend to make you feel your best
Comprehensive health and dental insurance
Holiday bonuses in appreciation of your hard work
Fully remote setup — work from anywhere you're comfortable
Opportunities to grow with us as we scale
If you're passionate about people data and want to make a measurable impact inside a fast-growing organization, we’d love to hear from you. Submit your application and let’s build something great together.

Title: FX Trader / OTC FX Dealer
Description:
We are hiring for an *FX Trader / OTC FX Dealer* to actively trade *NGN against G3 currencies (USD, GBP, EUR)* and execute *OTC FX transactions* as a *revenue-generating desk.* The role owns *FX pricing, position management, liquidity, and trading P&L*, supporting both internal flows and external counterparties.
This is a *front-office trading role*, not a back-office treasury position.
*Key Responsibilities*
•	Monitor FX markets and *set live NGN–G3 exchange rates* on internal pricing dashboards.
•	Act as a *market maker*, quoting two-way prices and dynamically managing spreads.
•	Originate, negotiate, and execute *OTC FX trades* with banks, brokers, and liquidity providers.
•	Manage *FX positions*, weighted average rates, and daily trading P&L.
•	Optimize liquidity across multiple currencies and settlement rails (FPS, ACH, Wire, SWIFT, NIBSS, SEPA).
•	Execute and oversee FX settlements and ensure timely reconciliation of treasury accounts.
•	Lead onboarding and relationship management of liquidity providers and OTC counterparties.
•	Improve trading and settlement processes to reduce risk and increase execution efficiency.
•	Work closely with Compliance to ensure FX and OTC trades meet regulatory and AML requirements.
•	Apply *basic understanding of stablecoins and crypto liquidity* as part of settlement, hedging, or routing strategies where applicable.
*Key Requirements*
•	Minimum of 3+ years’ experience in *FX trading, OTC FX dealing, or treasury trading* in a cross-border payments company, fintech or IMTO environment.
•	Proven experience trading *NGN vs USD, GBP, and EUR.*
•	Strong understanding of FX pricing, market making, and position management.
•	Track record of *P&L ownership* in FX markets.
•	Experience managing liquidity and settlements across multiple payment rails.
•	*Basic understanding of stablecoins and crypto markets*, including how they are used for liquidity, settlement, or hedging.
•	Strong numerical, analytical, and risk management skills.

Title: Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a premier, fast-growing agency supporting over 700 global E-Commerce brands, is seeking a highly skilled
Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
. Your core mission is to optimize our internal staffing, productivity, and labor capacity across all departments (Recruitment, CS, Team Operations). This role is the operational engine behind our growth, focusing on building, maintaining, and refining the quantitative models that govern how, when, and where we staff our business. If you thrive in a high-velocity BPO environment and excel at translating raw operational data into actionable staffing constraints and efficiency gains, this is your opportunity.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Workforce Modeling & Capacity Planning (The Primary Focus)
Own and refine TalentPop’s internal workforce and capacity models across all business functions to determine optimal staffing levels.
Analyze labor capacity utilization, productivity metrics, and department efficiency to proactively identify staffing needs, constraints, and resource reallocation opportunities.
Establish weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring targets in partnership with departmental leadership based on rigorous labor capacity analysis.
Develop predictive models for attrition, bandwidth risk, and internal resource shortages, especially in high-volume hiring environments.
II. Operational Analytics & Efficiency
Model "what-if" analyses to quantify the impact of changes in staffing, performance, or process improvements on department load and company-wide labor requirements.
Monitor key departmental KPIs (capacity utilization, output per FTE, efficiency trends) and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership.
Build dashboards and reporting tools focused on productivity, efficiency, and resource allocation for leadership and operational managers.
III. Recruitment Funnel Analysis
Maintain applicant forecasting models that project future supply based on historical conversion rates and expected demand.
Track and analyze recruitment performance metrics, including interview-to-hire ratios, pass/fail trends, and time-to-fill, to optimize the hiring workflow.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience focused on workforce planning, headcount forecasting, and operations analytics in a high-volume BPO, outsourcing, or call center environment.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (complex modeling, scenario analyses).
Proven ability to interpret complex operational data and deliver actionable staffing and efficiency recommendations.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: Un REDACTEUR(TRICE) confirmé.e

About the job
The Security Manager, Sagamu is responsible for providing strategic leadership and driving robust security operations in the Sagamu Plant. The role requires a self-sufficient professional capable of managing complex situations, including crisis response and high-impact decision-making. The Security Manager will support the implementation of security strategies and policies, deliver routine tactical support, and contribute to the wider Security & Resilience Department in safeguarding our people and assets. As a key member of the Sagamu Plant Leadership Team, the role also oversees Transport Services for all staff and light vehicles in the region. Success in this position demands strong vigilance, disciplined planning, clear reporting, and the highest level of integrity.
What you'll be doing
General:
Support the deployment of Security & Business Resilience Programs (policy, directives & tools).
Support the promotion of Security & Business Resilience culture by identifying training & awareness needs, and ensuring their implementation
Raise Security & Business Resilience awareness amongst all staff by organizing periodic table-top exercises (GLMR as a priority).
Manage the security & transport services function in the assigned location(s), which includes managing an extensive guard force.
Manage the security provider and ensure that all contractual obligations are met.
Oversee the management of Public Security Forces personnel & ensure adherence to the UN Voluntary Principles on Security & Human rights (UNVPSHR) / Security Services with integrity
Provide daily, monthly, and as required, incident-based reports in order to support the implementation of mitigation measures as deemed necessary.
Oversee, drive and implement the ‘Security Blueprint’; ensuring that respective Action Plans are accurate and reflective.
Contribute holistically to the business effort and ensure no ‘silo mentality’ takes hold of management in both the department & at Plant locations.
Provide leadership, experience & expertise wherever such a contribution is deemed to be in support of the business and the overall goals set for management.
Ensure to maintain a detailed understanding of the local community setting, historical parameters and existing communications channels.
Keep log on operational issues ensuring the maintenance of a security incident archive (Incident Report Tracker / Security Incident Notification Tool)
Conduct and manage the GS&R Security Risk Assessment (SRA), and follow up on Action Plans’ generated.
Periodically review and ensure implementation of the GS&R Site Mapping Application(SMA) across respective operational sites.
Implementation of the Security & Resilience Management System (SRMS) across respective sites.
Ensure the implementation of Security Services with Integrity (SSI), and work closely with respective stakeholders for support.
Maintain a close relationship, including holding regular meetings, with the commanders of Public Security Forces (PSF): Nigeria Police Force: Commissioner of Police; Assistant Inspector General(AIG) who is charge of the Police Zone; Head of the State Intelligence and Investigation Bureau (SIIB), Department of State Security (DSS), Army, Nigeria Security & Civil Defense Corps (NSCDC)(if applicable), State comptrollers, Customs (if applicable) and any other PSF that may be particular to the respective site locations
Security:
Manage the security dimension in remote locations in a production Plant environment.
The Regional Security Manager is part of a security team, which is to be fully managed. This includes: Close supervision of all staff, monitoring & managing performance, application of &adherence to company rules & regulations.
Assign & monitor tasks.
Familiar with carrying out & recording of ‘Site Security Assessments’ (SSA)
Provide feedback that allow to improve department & local team performance, increase efficiency and economize on resources with a focus on cost reduction
Planning:
The Security Manager is to write & maintain various existing & future security plans. These are required to keep staff & assets safe with success being based on an excellent understanding of the environment (Ecosystem), in which we operate, and the capabilities of Public Security Forces deployed in support of the Lafarge operations.
It is a critical task of the Regional Security Manager to ensure that all security plans are kept current, constantly reviewed and exercised as much as is possible and feasible within the Plant & community setting
Event based security planning including convoy planning, vulnerability assessments, and similar
Ensure that pertinent plans are uploaded into the Nigeria Security & Resilience Management System (SRMS).
Transport Services
:
In this capacity the Security Manager ensures all transport missions are carried out with thin the rules & regulations of the business while in parallel ensuring the security & safety of all travelers.
Oversee the management of the ‘light vehicle’ fleet throughout the country. This includes all planning & administrative steps before and when committing transport services as requested by the business.
Driver management.
Vehicle management:
Maintenance
Road worthiness (in line with HS&E requirements)
Any other task as assigned
Human resources (HR):

Title: Spécialiste en engagement communautaire et insertion professionnelle des jeunes
Description:
Task description
Sous la supervision générale de la Cheffe de Section Éducation et du Développement des Adolescents (EDA) et la supervision directe de la Coordinatrice du projet SEFA (Soutien à l’Education des Filles et à leur Autonomisation), avec l’appui technique des autres membres de la section EDA le/la Volontaire des Nations Unies national/e effectuera les tâches suivantes : • Gestion de partenariat : - Garantir un appui rapproché aux Conseils régionaux de Dikhil, Ali Sabieh et Obock à travers la mise en œuvre du plan de travail annuel (PTA), la préparation technique et organisationnelle des activités régionales, l’aide à l’élaboration de documents programmatiques (des termes de référence, conventions de partenariats, des guides d’entretien, etc), ainsi qu’un accompagnement étroit pour leur déploiement en partenariat avec leurs acteurs. - Appuyer les membres des Conseils régionaux et leurs partenaires pour l’application des procédures administratives et financières en adéquation avec les normes standard requises par l’UNICEF en particulier la gestion de fonds et le rapportage de leur utilisation (FACE, ICE, approche harmonisée pour les transferts d’espèces) • Mise en œuvre des activités préalables au renforcement de compétences des jeunes : - Réaliser une analyse contextualisée des perspectives professionnelles et des marchés locaux dans chaque région, pour identifier les acteurs clés, besoins des populations et opportunités d’entrepreneuriat pour les jeunes filles. - Établir une cartographie des programmes existants en faveur de l’insertion et de l’autonomisation économique des jeunes dans les trois régions, en s’appuyant sur les données des acteurs publics, privés, des ONG et des agences internationales. - Organiser un atelier d’orientation professionnelle pour mieux connaître les attentes des jeunes. - Coordonner la préparation, la logistique et la mise en œuvre des formations pour les structures d’accueil, les jeunes stagiaires et volontaires. • Formation et intégration des adolescentes et des jeunes filles dans la communauté et dans le milieu professionnel : - Diffuser les informations auprès du secteur privé, des OSC et des entités publiques sur le programme de stages et de volontariat dans les régions cibles - Développer des partenariats pour coconstruire le guide de volontariat et le guide de stages, en se basant sur l’analyse des besoins communautaires, les opportunités disponibles et les aspirations des jeunes. - Mener les processus de sélection qui permettront d’identifier 67 jeunes par région qui seront accueillis comme stagiaires, et 33 jeunes par région qui seront accueillis comme volontaires dans les associations et structures communautaires et dans le secteur privé - Organiser des sessions de formation courtes pour les volontaires communautaires et les stagiaires, en se concentrant sur les secteurs prioritaires identifiés lors de l’évaluation des besoins - Identifier les options de modalités opérationnelles sur la contractualisation des jeunes participants à l'un ou l'autre des programmes (volontariat et stages) - Faciliter l’intégration des volontaires dans les associations et structures communautaires, ainsi que l’intégration des stagiaires dans le secteur privé par la mise en place de conventions de partenariats. • Suivi et Évaluation : - Assurer le suivi quotidien des activités, relayer les informations à l’équipe du projet, identifier les goulots d’étranglement, et élaborer des recommandations pour améliorer la mise en œuvre. - Définir et suivre régulièrement les indicateurs de performance des partenariats, analyser les résultats des études, et proposer des plans de formation adaptés - Identifier les goulots d’étranglement dans la mise en œuvre des activités et proposer des recommandations • Rapportage : - Rédiger les rapports d’analyse des perspectives professionnelles, de la cartographie des programmes existants sur la promotion de l’insertion des jeunes, de l’aspiration professionnelle des jeunes sélectionnés - Etablir des rapports réguliers des descentes sur terrain et des résultats des activités mises en œuvre - Elaborer les rapports mensuels des formations professionnelles, stages et volontariat - Élaborer un rapport final sur la performance et l’efficacité du programme de volontariat et de stages. - Fournir tous les autres soutiens nécessaires, à la demande, à la gestion de la planification, de la mise en œuvre, du suivi des progrès et des documentations de l'exécution financière et programmatique du projet, ou de manière plus générale à la section EDA de l’UNICEF Djibouti. En plus de ce qui précède, les Volontaires des Nations Unies sont censés : • Renforcer leurs connaissances et compréhension du concept du volontariat en lisant la documentation mise à disposition par le programme VNU, les publications externes et prendre activement part aux activités du programme VNU, par exemple s’impliquer dans les activités commémoratives de la Journée internationale des Volontaires (JIV), le 5 décembre. • Se familiariser et développer toute forme de volontariat traditionnel et/ou local au niveau du pays d’accueil. • Refléter le type et la nature des actions volontaires qu’ils entreprennent, y compris leur participation dans les réflexions substantielles. • Contribuer à la rédaction des articles sur les expériences de terrain à soumettre pour la publication du programme VNU/ site web, bulletin et notes de presse, etc. • Contribuer au Programme d’accueil des Volontaires des Nations Unies nouvellement arrivés dans le pays d’affectation; • Promouvoir ou conseiller les groupes locaux dans l’utilisation des volontaires en ligne ou encourager les individus et les organisations à utiliser les services de volontaires en ligne quand cela est techniquement possible. 11. Résultats attendus : Le/la VNU produira en harmonisation avec les autres Spécialistes en engagement communautaire et formation technique et professionnelle des autres régions, les livrables ci-dessous : a. Un plan de travail avec les étapes clés et un chronogramme mensuel et hebdomadaire pour la période d'affectation b. Un outil de suivi des avancements des activités c. Un plan de missions trimestriel et mensuel d. Un rapport de la sélection des 100 jeunes par région, incluant leurs aspirations et orientations professionnelles ainsi que les secteurs d’activités qu’ils ont choisis e. Une note méthodologique et les fiches de collecte des données pour la conduite de l’analyse des perspectives professionnelles ; et pour la cartographie des programmes existants promouvant l’insertion des jeunes en zones rurales et péri-urbaines f. Le rapport de cette analyse des perspectives professionnelles et de cette cartographie des programmes existants sur les options de formations techniques et professionnelles en mettant l'accent sur les formations de courte et moyenne durée, tant les formations techniques que les formations soft-skills) g. Un guide de stages et un guide de volontariat par secteur d’activité, zone géographique, adaptés des modules de formations existants en collaboration avec les acteurs ; h. Une base de données sur l’affectation des jeunes aux structures d’accueil, et par module de formation i. Des outils d’évaluation formative et sommative (études de cas, mise en situation/ simulation…) et d’évaluation de satisfaction ; j. Au niveau de la gestion générale du projet, la composante 3 du projet est planifiée, mise en œuvre et bien suivie pour son exécution avec un décaissement du financement et des documentations de qualité, dans le respect du chronogramme imparti
Assignment requirements
Relevant experience
5 years
Languages
French, Fluent level Required
Required education level
Master's degree in Diplôme de Master/Maitrise en formation technique et professionnelle, mobilisation communautaire, gestion de projet de développement, sciences sociales, sociologie, ou un domaine connexe
National UN Specialist Volunteers in Djibouti are entitled to:
• Monthly Volunteer Living Allowance (VLA) at the amount of DJF 296,333
• Annual and learning leaves
• Medical and life Insurance
• Free access to different learning platforms.
Apply by: 28 December 2025

Title: Gastvrouw / Gastheer Bijbaan
Description:
Ben jij die vriendelijke, behulpzame en betrokken gastvrouw / gastheer die graag de leden verwelkomt? Heb jij oog voor service en gastvrijheid, en vind je het belangrijk om de club netjes opgeruimd en schoon te houden voor onze leden? Dan is de rol van
Gastvrouw / Gastheer bij onze Basic-Fit club in Middelburg
de perfecte uitdaging voor jou! Wij zoeken iemand voor deze leuke bijbaan voor
17
uu
r
per week op vrijdag (15:00 - 21:00) en zondag (09:00 - 14:00)
. Spreekt dit jou aan? Lees snel verder!
Dit bieden wij
Werken Als Gastvrouw / Gastheer Bij Basic-Fit Betekent
Een bruto startsalaris van €14,46 per uur (vanaf 21 jaar). Ben je geen 21 jaar, dan gelden er aangepaste tarieven: €11,57 per uur (20 jaar), €8,68 per uur (19 jaar), €7,23 per uur (16-18 jaar);
Vakantietoeslag van 8%;
Een persoonlijke pensioentoeslag;
23 vakantiedagen per jaar (op basis van 40 uur);
Reiskostenvergoeding (0,23 cent per km, van 1 tot max. 35 km afstand woon,-werkverkeer);
Feestdagentoeslag van 50%.
De voordelen van werken bij Basic-Fit
Bij Basic-Fit geloven we in jouw potentieel. Groei mee met ons mee als internationaal bedrijf en grijp de kans om door te groeien binnen onze organisatie. Je hebt onbeperkt toegang tot alle online trainingen van GoodHabitz.
Je wordt onderdeel van de Orange Community waar diversiteit gevierd wordt en waar je jezelf mag zijn. Met de Orange Connect App ben je altijd verbonden en up-to-date.
Wat is er beter dan werken in een omgeving waar gezondheid en fitness voorop staan? Maak gebruik van de mogelijkheid om zelf te sporten en ervaar de energieke en positieve werksfeer.
Zo ziet jouw functie eruit
Iedereen met veel plezier naar de club laten terugkomen, daar doe je het voor! Als Gastvrouw / Gastheer ben jij het eerste aanspreekpunt van de club. Met een oprechte glimlach verwelkom je de leden en beantwoord je hun vragen. Je bent actief aanwezig op de werkvloer, stapt op de leden af, maakt een praatje en biedt met veel enthousiasme onze producten aan. Nieuwe leden geef je een rondleiding, adviseer je over onze lidmaatschappen en help je met hun inschrijving. Daarnaast zorg jij ervoor dat onze club tiptop in orde is: als jij er bent, zijn er geen rondslingerende gewichten of rommelige kleedkamers te bekennen. Hoewel je regelmatig jouw diensten alleen draait, werk je als team actief samen aan het resultaat van de club.
Wie zoeken wij?
Als Enthousiaste Gastvrouw / Gastheer Van Basic-Fit Heb Je
Een gastvrije, servicegerichte en energieke instelling;
Groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel voor het schoon en netjes houden van de club;
Affiniteit met sport en fitness.
Ook Ben Je
Beschikbaar: het werken op onregelmatige tijden, zoals avonden en weekenden, vormt voor jou geen enkel probleem. De diensten die op de 24/7 clubs worden gedraaid zijn: ma t/m vrij van 08:30 tot 15:00 uur of van 15:00 tot 21:00 uur, en op za/zo van 09:00 tot 14:00 uur. Op de non 24/7 clubs zijn de diensten die gedraaid worden: ma t/m vrij van 07:00 tot 15:00 uur of van 15:00 tot 22:30 uur, en op za/zo van 09:00 tot 16:00 uur;
Flexibel: je bent in staat om snel te schakelen bij veranderingen en invallen op nabijgelegen clubs zie je als een uitdaging;
Zelfstandig: je motiveert jezelf en anderen, ziet het werk liggen en pakt dit snel op;
Behulpzaam: met een enthousiaste houding sta je altijd klaar voor onze leden.
Over Basic-Fit
Basic-Fit is een dynamisch en sterk groeiende organisatie met een duidelijke missie. Inmiddels zijn wij de grootste fitness keten van Europa. Buiten Nederland hebben we clubs in België, Duitsland, Luxemburg, Frankrijk en Spanje. Ons doel is om de komende jaren verder te professionaliseren en door te groeien. Mede dankzij jouw inzet kunnen we onze groei realiseren en dat geeft weer nieuwe mogelijkheden voor jouw carrière om hierin mee te groeien!
Basic-Fit zet zich daarnaast in om een inclusieve werkgever te zijn die gelijke kansen biedt voor iedereen. Of je nu één van onze leden of medewerkers bent, wij hebben aandacht voor jouw welzijn en focussen ons op diversiteit! Waar je ook voor gaat, wij zijn er om je te ondersteunen en je te helpen met #becomfortable te voelen. Zo kun jij de wereld aan!
Klaar voor de uitdaging? Solliciteer direct!
Wil jij komen werken bij dé grootste fitnessketen van Europa? Solliciteer dan nu via de apply button, bovenaan deze vacature en wellicht maak jij binnenkort deel uit van de Orange Community van Basic-Fit!
Heb je nog een vraag over deze bijbaan? Neem dan contact op met recruitment@basic-fit.nl.
Sollicitaties via dit mailadres worden niet in behandeling genomen. (Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld)

Title: SATIC ERP Integrations Consultant
Description:
Our new South Africa Technology and Innovation Centre (SATIC) is the latest part of PwC, a global brand delivering services for the biggest clients in the world. PwC leads the way in human led, technology enabled professional services, working with clients to transform their business and make it fit for the future.
We are looking for candidates who bring in-depth market experience, who see technology as a way to enable and drive human innovation and who want to be a part of a community of solvers, to tackle the biggest challenges in society.
If you are looking for a career where every day is different, where challenges are complex and where you can make a real difference, then we want to hear from you. By choosing to join the SATIC, you are choosing to work with teams all over the world, harnessing the power of world leading tech and making a difference to real peoples lives.
This role can be based in Cape Town, Johannesburg or Durban.
We’re hiring an Integration's Consultant to build and support integrations on the Workday platform. You don’t need prior Workday experience—we will cross-train you.
If you’ve built integrations or data pipelines using APIs, ETL/iPaaS tools (e.g., MuleSoft, Boomi, Azure Integration Services), or have strong software/data engineering fundamentals and want to specialise in Workday, this role is for you.
What You’ll Do:
Deliver integrations end-to-end: requirements, design, build, test, deploy, and support using Workday technologies
Build reliable data flows to and from Finance systems (SFTP/API/event-driven), handling transforms (JSON, XML, CSV), mappings, and error handling/retries.
Author secure, compliant designs with appropriate authentication (OAuth/SAML), secrets management, logging, monitoring, and alerting.
Test thoroughly and support user acceptance testing; maintain migration/runbooks for environments.
Operate & support integrations post-go-live: triage incidents, fix defects, and optimise performance/throughput.
Document clearly: technical specs, sequence/flow diagrams, support guides, and KT materials.
Experience and expertise:
Previous experience in systems integration, data engineering, software engineering, or ETL/iPaaS delivery (or equivalent internships/projects). (A minimum of 1 years experience required)
Practical skills with APIs, file formats and transport protocols
Working knowledge of SQL and at least one programming/scripting language
Understanding of integration patterns and secure design principles
Strong analytical communication skills—able to translate requirements into technical designs and explain trade-offs.
A growth mindset: eagerness to learn Workday quickly through structured training and hands-on delivery.
Qualification:
A relevant tertiary qualification relevant to the role
Nice to Have:
Exposure to ERP/Finance systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Dynamics) or finance domain processes.
Experience with iPaaS/ETL (MuleSoft, Boomi, Azure Logic Apps/Data Factory, SnapLogic, Informatica).
Agencies please note:
This recruitment assignment is being managed directly by PwC’s Talent Acquisition team. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners in the rare instance we require additional talent options. Any speculative or unsolicited CVs received will be treated as a direct application. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

Title: Portfolio Specialist
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
About Discovery
Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.
Cogence
Cogence is the first truly global discretionary fund manager in South Africa. It marries the expertise of Discovery, whose behaviour-change platform is the largest of its kind, and BlackRock, one of the world's leading asset managers.
Using innovative and globally advanced technology, Cogence is the world's first discretionary fund manager that fully models retirement solutions, taking health experience into account, and is here to elevate the client investment experience to levels that have never been seen or experienced before.
Cogence is a wholly owned subsidiary of Discovery and aims to attract smart, energetic, and dynamic achievers who take initiative and ownership. We are looking for candidates that thrive in an environment of constant challenges and high-speed change
Key Purpose
The Portfolio Specialist role encompasses supporting roles across multiple aspects of the content marketing mix with a focus on investment reporting. The role requires writing, editing and proof-reading investment commentary and finding innovative approaches to responding to the needs of various client segments. From time-to-time the role will require developing marketing positioning and materials for new products or initiatives from scratch
Key Outputs / Job Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
A key focus is the development and maintenance of monthly and quarterly investment reporting:
— Strategy level client reporting
— Pitchbooks both standard and bespoke
— Regular performance commentaries and communications
The Role Will Also Require Contribution To
— Investment viewpoints and spotlights
— Written support on the broader Cogence value proposition content
— Thought leadership pieces positioning Cogence as a leader in the DFM space
— Strategic marketing campaigns
— Informative discussions on market events
The Portfolio Specialist role will be aligned with a set of investment capabilities.
This close alignment is designed to increase depth of knowledge and an understanding of how investment marketing will contribute to the firm’s objectives.
The role requires a candidate who is committed to building a high calibre of investment knowledge to support regular reporting requirements such as the quarterly reports with an understanding of how the firm’s range of clients use and interact with the investment strategies.
In addition, the role requires an understanding of how the investment capability fits into the broader Cogence value proposition and the ability to support the business to position the broader capability to the market in various formats from written to PowerPoint etc.
The candidate should demonstrate strong writing capabilities and an ability to work efficiently and effectively on presentations.
The candidate will have an interest in political and economic developments and how they affect markets. He/she should have the ability to write new content or edit existing material for a range of different audiences (institutional, financial advisers and direct investors ).
Writing, editing and proof-reading investment commentary covering various financial periods as required.
These typically describe the portfolio’s performance, the portfolio managers' rationale for investment decisions, ESG integration, portfolio positioning and the macroeconomic environment.
Creating, updating and preparing pitchbooks are both standardised and bespoke.
Support the development of relevant and insightful marketing content on the complete Cogence value proposition for different audience types.
Within the capability alignments, ongoing monitoring of commentary requirements and associated deadlines to ensure expectations are managed and achieved.
Work closely with the portfolio managers, client group and risk & performance to ensure the smooth implementation and timely production of investment commentary.
Ensure investment and strategy knowledge is current by attending relevant internal investment team meetings and keeping up to speed with industry news.
Being proactive in identifying current news stories or issues that could form the basis of updates for clients
The role requires thoughtful collaboration with the adjoining marketing functions (brand / design / digital) to create impactful campaigns with an optimal plan for dissemination and tracking for each of the investment marketing or broader value proposition campaigns
Finding innovative approaches to responding to the needs of various client segments and how marketing is relevant to them throughout each stage of the client journey. Investment Writers are tasked to explore and develop the most appropriate application of investment marketing throughout the journey
From time to time the role will require developing marketing positioning and materials for new products or initiatives from scratch. Working with product specialists/portfolio managers and designated client group champions on key positioning and the investment case for new products and developing appropriate launch packs – particularly core presentations and other marketing collateral (brochures, flyers, thought papers, multi-media)
Stakeholders include the BlackRock & RisCura investment teams, which form part of an outsourced arrangement with strong support from the Cogence CEO/CIO. In addition, internal stakeholders, more broadly speaking, include the operations, marketing, digital and sales teams.
Finally, the delivery of a unified and simplified message to market is critical to enable a good client experience, which makes the head of client strategy & solutions a key stakeholder and reporting line manager.
Education and Experience
Degree educated with an emphasis in communications, English, economics is essential
CFA qualification or studying towards is desirable.
Minimum of 7 years’ experience in a Technical Marketing role OR Portfolio Specialist with a strong focus on Investment writing.
Personal Attributes and Skills
Excellent written and editorial skills, appreciation for plain, effective English in marketing materials.
Good numeracy, awareness of data trends, analytical tools and key industry metrics used in investment marketing.
Investment writing speed test - Advanced
Values Driven
Optimistic
Learns on the Fly
Resilient
Instils Trust
People Savvy
Drives Results
Problem Solver
EMPLOYMENT EQUITY
The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.

Title: Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a premier, fast-growing agency supporting over 700 global E-Commerce brands, is seeking a highly skilled
Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
. Your core mission is to optimize our internal staffing, productivity, and labor capacity across all departments (Recruitment, CS, Team Operations). This role is the operational engine behind our growth, focusing on building, maintaining, and refining the quantitative models that govern how, when, and where we staff our business. If you thrive in a high-velocity BPO environment and excel at translating raw operational data into actionable staffing constraints and efficiency gains, this is your opportunity.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Workforce Modeling & Capacity Planning (The Primary Focus)
Own and refine TalentPop’s internal workforce and capacity models across all business functions to determine optimal staffing levels.
Analyze labor capacity utilization, productivity metrics, and department efficiency to proactively identify staffing needs, constraints, and resource reallocation opportunities.
Establish weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring targets in partnership with departmental leadership based on rigorous labor capacity analysis.
Develop predictive models for attrition, bandwidth risk, and internal resource shortages, especially in high-volume hiring environments.
II. Operational Analytics & Efficiency
Model "what-if" analyses to quantify the impact of changes in staffing, performance, or process improvements on department load and company-wide labor requirements.
Monitor key departmental KPIs (capacity utilization, output per FTE, efficiency trends) and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership.
Build dashboards and reporting tools focused on productivity, efficiency, and resource allocation for leadership and operational managers.
III. Recruitment Funnel Analysis
Maintain applicant forecasting models that project future supply based on historical conversion rates and expected demand.
Track and analyze recruitment performance metrics, including interview-to-hire ratios, pass/fail trends, and time-to-fill, to optimize the hiring workflow.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience focused on workforce planning, headcount forecasting, and operations analytics in a high-volume BPO, outsourcing, or call center environment.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (complex modeling, scenario analyses).
Proven ability to interpret complex operational data and deliver actionable staffing and efficiency recommendations.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a premier, fast-growing agency supporting over 700 global E-Commerce brands, is seeking a highly skilled
Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
. Your core mission is to optimize our internal staffing, productivity, and labor capacity across all departments (Recruitment, CS, Team Operations). This role is the operational engine behind our growth, focusing on building, maintaining, and refining the quantitative models that govern how, when, and where we staff our business. If you thrive in a high-velocity BPO environment and excel at translating raw operational data into actionable staffing constraints and efficiency gains, this is your opportunity.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Workforce Modeling & Capacity Planning (The Primary Focus)
Own and refine TalentPop’s internal workforce and capacity models across all business functions to determine optimal staffing levels.
Analyze labor capacity utilization, productivity metrics, and department efficiency to proactively identify staffing needs, constraints, and resource reallocation opportunities.
Establish weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring targets in partnership with departmental leadership based on rigorous labor capacity analysis.
Develop predictive models for attrition, bandwidth risk, and internal resource shortages, especially in high-volume hiring environments.
II. Operational Analytics & Efficiency
Model "what-if" analyses to quantify the impact of changes in staffing, performance, or process improvements on department load and company-wide labor requirements.
Monitor key departmental KPIs (capacity utilization, output per FTE, efficiency trends) and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership.
Build dashboards and reporting tools focused on productivity, efficiency, and resource allocation for leadership and operational managers.
III. Recruitment Funnel Analysis
Maintain applicant forecasting models that project future supply based on historical conversion rates and expected demand.
Track and analyze recruitment performance metrics, including interview-to-hire ratios, pass/fail trends, and time-to-fill, to optimize the hiring workflow.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience focused on workforce planning, headcount forecasting, and operations analytics in a high-volume BPO, outsourcing, or call center environment.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (complex modeling, scenario analyses).
Proven ability to interpret complex operational data and deliver actionable staffing and efficiency recommendations.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Description:

Do you enjoy working with evidence, shaping protocols, and mentoring nurses and care workers to shape nursing services at scale?
If yes, this role in Nurture Health’s Clinical Quality Team is for you.
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Nursing Specialist is a head-office (remote-first) nursing expert who empowers evidence-based nursing within Nurture’s hospitals by writing and improving nursing protocols, auditing and analysing outcomes, and assisting with the building of capabilities within our nursing and care teams nationwide.
Reporting to the Clinical Quality Manager, you will:
Collaborate with other specialists within the Clinical Quality Team to define and continuously improve Nurture’s nursing and other clinical protocols.
Travel regularly to Nurture’s hospitals nationwide, building capability across nursing teams through structured audits and mentorship.
Conduct and disseminate high quality research on the application of nursing practices within Nurture hospitals.
Serve as the custodian of Nurture–SANC relations, supporting regulatory alignment and continued professional development.
GUARANTEED MONTHLY REMUNERATION:
R 53 353.00 CTC (benefits included)
ABOUT YOU
You are the ideal candidate for this role if you have the following attributes:
Personal Attributes
A passion for nursing, and an innate respect for its role in physical rehabilitation.
Strong identification with the values as set out in the South African Nursing Council’s Code of Ethics for Nursing Practitioners.
A natural mentor and coach who is empathetic and approachable.
A self-starter, coupled with a preference for collaboration and teamwork.
Education, Experience, and Functional Learnings
Registered with the South African Nursing Council in the category of Professional Nurse.
Proven experience in successfully contributing to the development of nursing policies, processes, and automated systems within an integrated practice unit comprised of more than six healthcare professions.
Demonstrated experience in Nursing research, conference presentations, and/or peer-reviewed publications.
Possesses in-depth knowledge of the Nursing Act, 2005 (Act No. 33 of 2005) and the Generic Competency Framework for Advanced Nurse Practitioners of the South African Nursing Council.
ABOUT US
We work alongside Nurture Health to make it possible for people and their families to live meaningful and fulfilled lives despite physical impairment and disability resulting from health conditions.
WHAT WE DO
We partner with Nurture Health (South Africa’s largest physical rehabilitation hospital group) to provide facility-based, post-acute healthcare outside acute hospital settings.
Our winning recipe lies in our experienced, interdisciplinary teams who work collaboratively to achieve optimal outcomes for our patients and their families.
OUR VALUES
Collaboration
Innovation
Communication
Safety
Continuous Improvement
HOW TO APPLY?
Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their CV on https://nurturehealth.simplify.hr. NB: There is no closing date for this vacancy. The employer reserves the right to withdraw the advertisement at any time.

. The role will support the transformation of actuarial pricing structures into effective business processes and technical solutions within a short-term insurance environment. Training, Change & Governance

Identify risks and recommend mitigation strategies.
Continuous Improvement

Convert actuarial technical models into practical business and system solutions.
Identify opportunities to streamline rating processes and improve efficiency.
