Agile certification
Technical skills: SQL, API fundamentals, data modelling, XML

Minimum
7 years’ IT Business Analysis experience
, including
at least 5 years in Short-Term Insurance
3–5 years’ hands-on experience with rating engines, including:
Data dictionaries, data mapping, and product configuration
Data flows, sequence diagrams, and ERDs
APIs, system integrations, and SQL for data validation
Proven experience translating actuarial and pricing models into system requirements
Exposure to both Commercial and Personal Lines insurance products
Experience working within cross-functional Agile delivery teams
Required Knowledge & Skills

Practical Agile/Scrum delivery experience
Working knowledge of Azure DevOps or similar tools
Excellent documentation skills (BRDs, user stories, acceptance criteria)

Highly analytical with strong attention to detail

Title: Director | Digital & Insights | Strategic Communications
Description:
Who We Are
FTI Consulting is the leading global expert firm for organizations facing crisis and transformation. We work with many of the world's top multinational corporations, law firms, banks and private equity firms on their most important issues to deliver impact that makes a difference. From resolving disputes, navigating crises, managing risk and optimizing performance, our teams respond rapidly to dynamic and complex situations.
At FTI Consulting, you'll work side-by side with leaders who have shaped history, helping solve the biggest challenges making headlines today. From day one, you'll be an integral part of a focused team where you can make a real impact. You'll be surrounded by an open, collaborative culture that embraces diversity, recognition, professional development and, most importantly, you.
Are you ready to make your impact?
About The Role
FTI Consulting's Strategic Communications team is seeking a talented and versatile senior hire to join our Digital & Insights practice in Johannesburg, South Africa. This is an opportunity to play a key role within an ambitious and fast-growing team, advising some of the world's most high-profile companies on their reputation, digital presence, and stakeholder engagement.
The ideal candidate will bring deep experience in digital communications, corporate reputation, integrated campaigning, and the strategic use of data and analytics, combined with sound judgement and an ability to manage complex client relationships. This role suits someone who is ready to play a pivotal role in landing and leading major accounts, drive creative thinking, and act as a trusted advisor, while also looking to continue growing their leadership career within a collaborative and entrepreneurial environment.
The position will be filled in line with the FTI Consulting's culture, values and Employment Equity policy and plan.
What You'll Do
Client delivery
Serve as a senior advisor to key corporate clients across a range of sectors, often in high-stakes or reputationally sensitive contexts
Lead the development and execution of integrated communications programmes across stakeholder groups, with a focus on digital channels and platforms
Create high-quality content and insights that support reputation management, CEO positioning, public campaigns, and digital strategy
Advise clients on how to navigate new digital frontiers, including the reputational implications of AI search, generative content, and evolving content ecosystems
Work closely with colleagues across a range of sectors including financial services, public affairs, TMT, life sciences and employee engagement to design integrated reputation campaigns
Apply insight from data and analytics to shape campaign direction, narrative development, and channel selection
Use real-time performance data to optimise live campaigns and proactively identify risks or opportunities
Collaborate with our in-house data and analytics experts to develop and sell new insight-driven offers, enhance campaign planning, and ensure a forward-looking approach to measurement and reputation intelligence
Business leadership
Contribute to new business development by identifying opportunities, leading proposals, and presenting to prospective clients
Support the growth of the Digital & Insights team through innovation, thought leadership, and evolving our offer
Ensure work is grounded in meaningful metrics and KPIs that link to reputation or commercial outcomes
Take responsibility for commercial performance and resourcing across your client portfolio
Team involvement
Coach and mentor junior colleagues, and play an active role in fostering a high-performing, inclusive team culture
Champion collaboration across practices to develop cohesive client programmes that reflect the full range of stakeholder needs
Share relevant external trends, innovations and competitive intelligence with the wider group, helping the team stay ahead of emerging reputational risks, platform changes and stakeholder behaviours
Actively shape and evolve team-wide best practice in areas such as digital campaigning, insight-led communications and integrated planning, ensuring that standards reflect both innovation and effectiveness across our work
How You'll Grow
We are committed to investing and supporting you in your professional development and we have developed a range of programs focused on fostering leadership, growth and development opportunities. We aim to promote continuous learning and individual skills development through on-the-job learning, self-guided professional development courses and certifications. You'll be assigned a dedicated coach to mentor, guide and support you through regular coaching sessions and serve as an advocate for your professional growth.
As you progress through your career at FTI Consulting, we offer tailored programs for critical professional milestones to ensure you are prepared and empowered to take on your next role.

Title: Strategic Benefits Consultant
Location: City of Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa
Description:
ROLE OVERVIEW
We are looking for Strategic Benefits Consultants who
combine analytical rigor with executive influence
.
This is
not a traditional sales role
. This is
consulting-first, growth-second
position where your ability to interpret workforce data, generate insights, and guide strategic conversations will directly unlock commercial opportunities.
You will work with HR leaders, Finance heads, and C-suite executives to surface workforce realities they may not fully appreciate, translating complex patterns into actionable recommendations. The role is about trusted influence, not product pitching, and requires a mix of
numeracy, commercial acumen, and executive presence
.
We are intentionally looking outside of the traditional financial services, employee benefits, or insurance sectors. If you thrive on solving complex problems, enjoy engaging senior stakeholders, and want to drive meaningful impact while delivering growth, this is the role for you.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive Insight-Led Growth
Identify and cultivate growth opportunities through data-backed insight and strategic analysis (within existing accounts and externally)
Lead solutions conversations from a consultative, evidence-driven perspective, unlocking opportunities others may overlook
Build long-term, high-value client partnerships by demonstrating a deep understanding of employee experience, workforce challenges, and business priorities
Lead Strategic Client Engagements
Own and manage relationships with a portfolio of major employer clients
Establish yourself as the trusted adviser to HR, Finance, and executive stakeholders using analytical insight to reframe workforce challenges and guide executive decision-making
Lead discussions that focus on business objectives, employee outcomes, and long-term impact - not products or services
Orchestrate Integrated Delivery
Coordinate a cross-functional team of specialists (healthcare, credit, retirement, and more) to deliver cohesive, insight-driven strategies
Act as the single point of accountability for overall client experience - ensuring unified messaging and seamless execution across all service lines
Leverage Insight to Influence
Use anonymised data, diagnostics, and engagement metrics to challenge client assumptions and open new strategic conversations
Introduce forward-thinking discussions around financial wellbeing, employee resilience, and workforce optimisation, helping clients understand where interventions will have the greatest impact
Persuade and influence senior stakeholders to adopt strategic solutions based on your insights, turning analysis into actionable outcomes and opening doors to commercial opportunities
Ideal Candidate Profile
Essential Attributes
Executive presence and influence:
Able to persuade and engage senior stakeholders, including C-suite, HR, and Finance leaders, shaping decisions with credibility and impact
Strong analytical and numerate skills:
Comfortable interpreting complex data, generating actionable insights, and translating patterns into strategic recommendations
Commercial acumen:
Experienced in insight-led, solution-oriented engagements with a focus on growing strategic accounts
Performance-driven:
Strong appetite for variable earnings based on success
Intellectually curious and adaptable:
Confident navigating unfamiliar sectors or subject matter, with a continuous learning mindset
REQUIREMENTS
Preferred Background and Qualification
We welcome candidates from diverse professional backgrounds, including consulting, B2B sales, SaaS, HR technology, or commercial leadership in any sector. Career changers with strong business foundations (e.g. business degrees or MBAs) seeking strategic client-facing roles are encouraged to apply.
ABOUT US
At
NMG Benefits
, we are driven by a simple yet powerful philosophy:
Finding a Better Way.
This commitment shapes everything we do, from consulting to crafting innovative solutions for brighter financial futures. Our expertise spans consulting, actuarial, and administration services in healthcare and retirement fund environments, enhanced by personalised financial planning for individuals. This comprehensive approach enables us to deliver seamless, end-to-end solutions tailored to the needs of employers and their employees.
We encourage our clients to view employee benefits through an actuarial lens, fostering policies that drive productivity, loyalty, and engagement. Our focus is on protecting the financial security of employees while ensuring the long-term stability of the organisations they serve - building enduring and successful partnerships.
At NMG, our leadership and team recognise the privilege and trust placed in us to safeguard our clients' financial wellbeing. We’re proud to be the trusted advisors of over 50 blue-chip South African companies, guiding their strategies with insights that inspire confidence and results.
WHY JOIN NMG?
Reputation with Purpose:
We’re not just participating in conversations about employee wellness—we’re shaping the future of it.
A Platform for Innovation:
You’ll help design and deliver a new model for employer impact in a fast-evolving landscape.
High-Performance Culture:
Competitive base compensation with substantial upside potential aligned to your success.
Meaningful Work:
Make a tangible difference in the lives of employees facing real-life challenges, from financial stress and debt to healthcare and legacy planning.
Industries: Financial Services, Insurance, and Research Services

Title: ASIC Verification Engineer
Description: Responsibilities include development of test environments and tests to enable functional verification of large, multi-million gate ASICs.  Additional responsibilities include verification plan development, code coverage analysis, formal equivalency checking, and behavioral modeling.  The qualified candidate will be knowledgeable in Verilog and/or VHDL, C/C++, Java, or other programming languages. The qualified candidate will be knowledgeable in industry-standard simulators (VCS, MTI, NC-Verilog), gate-level simulation techniques, and logic debug.  Additional experience with formal verification tools, hardware design and debug, constrained-random verification techniques, and System Verilog is a plus.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Location:
Nairobi, Kenya (Hybrid/Remote options available)
Reports to:
Data Science Manager
About Pezesha
Pezesha is a leading embedded finance company that provides affordable and data-driven credit solutions to MSMEs across Africa. We combine technology, alternative data, and financial partnerships to close the $360B financing gap for small businesses while ensuring sustainable financial inclusion.
We are looking for a
Senior Data Scientist
to join our team and lead the development of advanced credit risk models, strategic insights, and business intelligence tools that drive high repayment rates, operational efficiency, and portfolio growth. This role is critical in strengthening our risk management framework and scaling our impact across the continent.
Core Responsibilities
Credit Risk Model Development
Develop, test, and iterate credit risk models on a quarterly basis.
Ensure repayment rates consistently exceed
95%
, with a default rate of less than
3%
across all portfolios.
Strategic Data Insights
Provide data-driven insights and reports to portfolio leads, senior management, and external stakeholders.
Translate findings into actionable strategies to enhance performance and mitigate risks.
Data Extraction, Cleaning & Mining
Lead the end-to-end processes of data extraction, cleaning, transformation, and mining.
Build datasets that power descriptive, predictive, and spatial models to support decision-making.
Cross-Functional Experimentation
Design and lead experiments across business units to optimize products, processes, and risk strategies.
Measure and communicate results to ensure learnings drive continuous improvements.
Business Intelligence Development
Develop and enhance BI tools to maximize product efficiency, improve Lifetime Value (LTV), and gross margins.
Deliver at least two major BI tool enhancements or new feature implementations per quarter.
Real-Time Dashboards & Reporting
Build and maintain real-time dashboards with a 99% uptime and accuracy target.
Deliver monthly finance reports on-time and with > 99% accuracy in reports. Continuously add to exception reports to enhance portfolio quality and leverage AI + automation to improve reporting processes.
Ensure accurate and timely lender reporting, portfolio impact analysis, and internal business reporting.
Documentation & Transparency
Maintain clear documentation of models, experiments, and workflows to ensure reproducibility and transparency.
Mentorship & Team Leadership
Mentor junior data scientists and analysts, fostering a collaborative, learning-driven culture.
Lead the data science team in setting priorities, managing workloads, and delivering high-quality outputs.
Task Delegation & Ad Hoc Priorities
Execute tasks assigned by the
CEO, COO, Data Science Manager or CDO
, prioritizing based on organizational goals and impact.
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
LMS Accuracy:
Achieve and maintain ≥
98% accuracy
in Learning Management System data validation.
Sprint Completion:
Deliver
90%+ completion rate
for planned sprints on time.
SLA Adherence:
Maintain
95%+ adherence
to Service Level Agreements (SLAs) across data services.
Knowledge Transfer:
Deliver and track
quarterly KT sessions
and training for the data team.
Credit Risk Model Performance:
Maintain
95% repayment rate
and <
3% default rate
via model iterations.
Business Intelligence:
Deliver at least
2 new BI enhancements/features per quarter
to improve reporting and decision-making.
Qualifications & Skills
Master’s or higher in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field.
6+ years of proven experience in data science, machine learning, and credit risk modeling (preferably in fintech or financial services).
Strong expertise in Python, R, SQL, and big data tools.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, etc.).
Proficiency in data visualization tools (PowerBI, ggplot, or plotly).
Strong understanding of credit risk management, repayment behavior, and portfolio analytics.
Excellent leadership, mentoring, and cross-functional collaboration skills.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Why Join Pezesha?
Be part of a mission-driven company enabling financial inclusion for MSMEs across Africa.
Work with a high-impact, data-driven team solving real-world financial challenges.
Opportunities for growth, leadership, and regional exposure in a fast-scaling fintech.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.
To Apply:
Please send a single pdf file containing a brief and bullet-pointed Cover Letter and your CV on the subsequent page(s) with “Ref: 2025-
Senior Data Scientist
” as the subject of your email to jobs@pezesha.com. Interviews will be done on a rolling basis. In your application kindly add/attach the information below to jobs@pezesha.com
At least one related project that you have worked on and accessible on Github
Attach your up to date CV

Excellent customer service and communication skills
Strong leadership and team management abilities
Problem-solving and decision-making skills

Strong organizational and planning capabilities
Proficiency in Microsoft Office & CRM system

National Diploma or Degree in Supply Chain, Procurement, or related field.
2-4 years' experience in procurement, purchasing, or supply chain support.
Familiarity with procurement systems or ERP platforms.

Strong administrative, organisational, and communication skills.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Knowledge of ISO standards and B-BBEE procurement regulations (advantageous)

Participative Leadership
Planning and Organizing
Monitoring and Measuring

Analysis and Attention to detail
Problem Solving
Critical thinking
Interpersonal Capabilities:
Assertive

Drive and Action Oriented
Flexibility
Excellence and Quality Orientation

Title: Consultant, Morocco
Description:
Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
What You'll Do
Play a pivotal role in cross-functional teams to solve complex client challenges across various industries and geographics.

Title: Procurement Buyer
Description:
ABOUT YOUR NEW JOB
As a Junior Buyer, you will assist in the selection and procurement of products that align with the company's brand and customer needs. This role involves market research, trend analysis, and negotiation with suppliers to ensure the best assortment.
ABOUT YOUR NEW JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Purchase order management, including tracking/expediting to ensure a cost-efficient and on-time supply of materials according to demand.
Provides support to the commodity strategy in developing a business listing of preferred suppliers
Search and identify new suppliers
Actively searches for potential standardization and improvement opportunities in respective areas.
Communicates efficiently and professionally with internal and external stakeholders.
Monitors supplier performance and reports it to relevant stakeholders
Identifies stakeholder requirements and supports the execution process.
Negotiates local contracts in conjunction with relevant procurement managers
Develop and implement strategies for negotiations with suppliers
Ensures items are delivered on time and expedited where necessary
Determine the purchasing needs and work with other parts of the organization to forecast demand and evaluate inventory levels.
Negotiate with vendors to get the best possible pricing and payment options. Bid, award, and administer project supply, services and purchase orders to suppliers.
Cost management to identify areas of potential cost reduction and analyze the impact of pricing changes for goods and services.
Conduct routine supplier business reviews, evaluating supplier performance.
ARE THESE YOUR SECERET INGRIDIENTS
Minimum 0-1 year of work experience in the procurement area
Deep understanding and professional experience with Purchasing Contracts
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Basic knowledge of negotiation skills
Market knowledge and experience in working across various functions, businesses and regions
HOW WE WILL SUPPORT YOU
You will have a buddy who will introduce you to the business, your daily routines during your onboarding period.
International career opportunities: As a large and expanding company, we offer unique opportunities for role changes and enriching experiences and capabilities, including cross-functional transitions and international assignments.
4 unique core values: Customer first, We over I, Make it simple and Deliver sustainably form the foundation of a robust culture that enables continuous and sustainable growth.
Competitive remuneration and social package
ABOUT YOUR NEW TEAM
We are Coca-Cola Hellenic, a growth-focused consumer goods business and strategic bottling partner of the Coca-Cola Company. We bottle, distribute and sell an unrivalled range of products in 29 markets in Europe, Africa and Eurasia. As we do, we create value for all stakeholders, support socio-economic growth and build a more positive environmental impact.
We bring together more than 30,000 people from over 70 nationalities, coming from five continents. The diversity of our markets, from mature to emerging economies, provides a wide range of attractive opportunities for growth.
We nurture our talents. We give opportunities to people across all functions and levels, as well as different geographies, backgrounds, and education. We are willing to take a risk on the people we believe in, even if they do not have the perfect experience. We have faith in what every person can be.
And although we have so much to be proud of, we always stay humble. We believe the real magic happens – for us and for you – when we OPEN UP."

This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.

Title: ASIC Verification Engineer

Additional experience with formal verification tools, hardware design and debug, constrained-random verification techniques, and System Verilog is a plus.

noon, the region's leading consumer commerce platform. On December 12th, 2017,

delivery, quick-commerce, fintech, and fashion. noon is a work in progress; we’re six

Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving capabilities
Entrepreneurial and go getter spirit
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

We’re looking for candidates who thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic start-up environment. We’re searching for problem solvers, people who operate with a bias for action and have a deep understanding of the importance of resourcefulness over reliance.

Description:

Job Description
Assistant Accountant
Finance
This family develops, refines, and implements the financial policies, plans, measures, and controls to safeguard and accurately report on the financial results of the business
Job Summary
This role carries out varied accounting tasks and assignments including compilation, consolidation and analysis of financial data and completes rotations, under varying levels of supervision. It is focused on developing the skills and capabilities needed to take on an Accountant role within Survitec
Duties And Responsibilities
Carries out a range of accounting activities under the guidance of more senior colleagues to support the compilation, consolidation, and analysis of financial data
Tracks progress against budgets within established finance systems and reports variances as appropriate, ensuring compliance with local market financial laws, requirements, and regulations
Implements aspects of the global Survitec control framework, developing and maintaining financial controls
Collates and analyses data using standard accounting methodologies, systems, tools, and formats to deliver high quality monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting to the business, under varying degrees of supervision

Works with senior colleagues to develop appropriate action plans, reporting and escalating findings as necessary according to Survitec policy and best practice
Creates an environment where everyone in the team can live the Survitec Values
Contributes positively to creating an inclusive environment where our people feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work
Understands, upholds, and contributes to creating a safety-first culture within Survitec. Ensures a safe and healthy working environment
Develops own capabilities through participating in assessment and development planning activities as well as formal and informal training and coaching. Develops and maintains an understanding of relevant technology, external regulation, and industry best practices
Skills
Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments
Anticipates and adopts innovations in business digital and technology applications
Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
Plans and prioritises work to meet commitments aligned with Survitec goals
Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
Applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance Survitec’s goals
Makes good and timely decisions that keep Survitec moving forward
Interprets and applies key financial indicators to make better business decisions
Values
Drives safety culture
Is a reliable source of reference on relevant safety standards and where these standards are at risk. Provides important insight into the root cause and corrective actions for such safety risks and issues. Raises issues and highlights own mistakes without fear to improve safety and wellbeing of self and others
Demonstrates commitment to delivering real value and confidence to our customers
Understands the importance of being the representative of both internal and external customers. Demonstrates respect for those customers and is open and transparent about the delivery of service – only promises what they can deliver and delivers what they promise
We care for our people, investing in the development of teams and individuals
Understands own role within the team and takes accountability for delivery – is good at closing out actions and proactively asks for help when issues arise. Communicates appropriately, shares knowledge (coaching, mentoring, and supporting others to develop skills as appropriate). Works collaboratively with own team and others to meet business goals
Takes time to listen and treats others with dignity, accepting and respecting other people’s points of view or individuality. Understands how own behaviours impact others.
We aim for excellence in everything we do
Takes personal responsibility for ensuring excellence, getting the task done on time and to the right standard. Consistently achieves targets, even when timescales are tight
Committed and passionate about continuous improvement, looking to solve problems and avoid workarounds. Takes initiative and acts with confidence
We seek to innovate at every opportunity
Takes an entrepreneurial approach to change, being comfortable and willing to try out new methods, processes, ways of working or techniques to make improvements
Takes time to understand and explain the rationale for change to support the understanding of self and others
We act with integrity
Acts in accordance with Survitec Values, especially in situations when it is difficult to do so
Represents self and Survitec in an ethical manner that engenders trust from colleagues, customers, and external regulators
(Refer to Survitec Code of Conduct for further information and examples)
Experience And Qualification
Educated to university degree level, or vocational equivalent
6 – 12 months of under-graduate work experience, where course structure supports this

Title: Marketing Activation Manager (Bledina)
Description:
About The Job
Danone MENA recherche un Marketing
Activation Manager
talentueux(se), basé à
Alger, Algérie
, comme vous!
Rejoignez notre équipe commerciale en tant que
Marketing Activation Manager
et jouez un rôle clé dans le développement et l'exécution du Plan Opérationnel Annuel Maghreb pour les marques SN, à travers un alignement transversal avec l'équipe de direction HN, le marketing régional MENA, afin de stimuler une croissance durable et rentable en accord avec la vision de l'entreprise pour atteindre les objectifs pays et mettre en œuvre les plans et stratégies marketing.
CONTEXTE BUSINESS & DÉFIS CLÉS
Le
Marketing Activation Manager
est entièrement responsable de l’exécution des initiatives et activités marketing pour les marques assignées. Il/elle s’aligne avec l’équipe de direction HN et le département marketing pour garantir le bon fonctionnement de l’activité SN au Maghreb, via une planification et une gestion efficace du budget A&P. Le/la Responsable Activation Marketing contribue à l’analyse de marché en utilisant efficacement les ressources disponibles, conformément aux règles et réglementations internes/locales.
PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS
Participer au processus de planification annuelle (AOP) en surveillant et en exécutant les plans budgétaires A&P après alignement avec l’équipe de direction HN, les équipes marketing régionales et médicales.
Collecter et analyser les données pour comprendre les tendances du marché, les activités des concurrents et le comportement de la cible afin de recommander des actions pour atteindre les objectifs annuels de ventes et de profits.
Sur la base des besoins métiers communiqués par les responsables pays HN, développer, exécuter et suivre la mise en œuvre des plans marketing annuels.
Diriger les lancements de produits et la gestion du portefeuille en analysant les données de vente pour mettre à jour un portefeuille de marques ou de catégories.
Faire le lien entre les équipes transversales pour garantir la mise en œuvre des plans marché Maghreb.
Administrer et suivre les activités marketing.
Suivre la planification du budget A&P et surveiller les dépenses A&P.
Analyser le succès des campagnes marketing et élaborer des rapports.
Soutenir l’équipe Maghreb selon les besoins, notamment pour les présentations PowerPoint, les informations marché/concurrentielles, les insights marché et les présentations clients.
Acquérir une compréhension approfondie des objectifs et priorités pays auprès des responsables HN et du directeur pays afin de s’aligner transversalement sur les plans nécessaires à la réalisation des objectifs pays.
Communiquer efficacement avec les autres départements de l’organisation et assurer la compréhension et l’alignement adéquat de toutes les parties prenantes concernées sur les plans marketing.
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les homologues marketing, les agences de publicité, les agences de marketing digital, les sociétés de production et garantir l’application et l’exécution cohérentes de la stratégie de marque.
Se tenir informé(e) des insights consommateurs et marché tels que le volume des ventes, la part de marché, les prévisions de bénéfices, la tarification et la distribution.
About you Profil recherché
Pour réussir dans ce rôle, vous devez avoir
Formation en marketing
Au moins 3 ans d’expérience dans le secteur du marketing pharmaceutique
Solides compétences en gestion de projet
Excellentes compétences en analyse de données
Leadership avéré
Capacité à travailler de manière transversale
Excellentes compétences en communication
Langues requises
La maîtrise de l’arabe, de l’anglais et du français est indispensable.
Valeurs Danone
Les candidats sont attendus pour adhérer aux valeurs fondamentales de Danone Humanisme, Ouverture, Proximité & Enthousiasme.
About Us À Propos De Danone
Danone est un leader mondial de l’alimentation opérant dans trois divisions Produits Laitiers Frais, Nutrition Spécialisée et Eaux. La mission de Danone est d’apporter la santé par l’alimentation au plus grand nombre et nous souhaitons inviter chacun à rejoindre le mouvement pour un monde plus sain. Nous reconnaissons le pouvoir que chacun a d’influencer le monde à travers ses choix quotidiens. À chaque repas et boisson, nous votons pour le monde dans lequel nous voulons vivre. Nous croyons qu’un corps sain a besoin d’une alimentation saine, et qu’une alimentation saine a besoin d’une planète saine, ce qu’incarne notre nouvelle signature « One Planet One Health ».
Ce que nous offrons
Travailler chez Danone MENA est l’un des meilleurs moyens de bâtir une carrière solide grâce à l’apprentissage quotidien, à l’autonomisation et à la collaboration en équipe dans une culture et un environnement ouvert.
Notre culture encourage l’autonomie et la responsabilisation, où chaque jour peut-être une nouvelle aventure, pleine de possibilités et d’opportunités pour votre développement.
Danone MENA valorise ce qui fait votre unicité. Nous sommes fiers d’être un employeur qui respecte l’égalité des chances, où tous les recrutements sont basés sur les qualifications, le mérite et les besoins de l’entreprise. Nous recrutons, employons, formons et promouvons sans considération de race, couleur, religion, handicap, sexe, origine nationale, âge, caractéristiques génétiques ou tout autre statut protégé. Fidèles à nos valeurs d’ouverture et d’humanisme, tous nos collaborateurs s’engagent à interagir avec dignité et respect.
Une exposition internationale et des opportunités d’évolution.

Title: Field Officer
Description:
Our Profile
People in Need is a non-governmental, non-profit organization founded on the ideals of humanity, freedom, equality and solidarity.
People in Need was established in 1992 by a group of Czech war correspondents, journalists and activists and has grown to become one of the largest non-profit organizations in Central and Eastern Europe.
Throughout our 30 years of existence, People in Need continues to engage in humanitarian aid, development cooperation, education and social inclusion.
We have been operating in Ethiopia since 2003, working in Five regions; Oromia, Central Ethiopia, South Ethiopia, Sidama and Tigray in different multi sectoral projects in the areas of development and emergency response.
People in Need, from the very start of its operations in Ethiopia, has focused on projects in five main areas of interest: Education, Agriculture, Climate and Environment, Water and Social protection.
We are part of Alliance 2015, (https://www.alliance2015.org/ a strategic network of seven European non-governmental organizations engaged in humanitarian aid and development projects. This collaboration increases effectiveness, both in working in the target countries and in campaigns change to advocacy aimed at influencing the attitudes and policies of politicians and general public opinion and awareness in Europe.
More information at https://www.peopleinneed.net/ or HERE.

Title: HEAD OF SALES (JMC MOTOR DIVISION)
Description:

The Head of Sales is responsible for leading, shaping, and driving the commercial performance of the organization.
This role oversees the end-to-end sales function, ensuring the development and execution of robust sales strategies,
the effective management of sales teams, the strengthening of key customer relationships, and the consistent achievement of revenue and profitability targets. The Head of Sales plays a pivotal leadership role in steering business growth, identifying market opportunities, and ensuring the company maintains a competitive edge.

Prepare and present comprehensive weekly and monthly reports to the ED/Chairman, highlighting sales performance, market insights, business risks, and strategic recommendations.

Champion continuous improvement across the sales function, including process optimization, performance management, and customer relationship enhancement.

Minimum of 15 years’ experience in a multinational or structured corporate environment, preferably within the automotive or related industry.

Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire teams, influence stakeholders, and build strong business relationships.

Title: Senior Human Resources Officer
Description:
GFC For Energy Services is an Oil & Gas / Energy services provider based in Cairo with various world class customers in MENA. We are Specialized in rotating and static equipment maintenance and installations.
Currently we are expanding our HR department and looking for a specialist to support and grow our team. In this role you will support, and empower the team as we continue to deliver services across the region. You will work closely with the founders to support the company's vision & mission.
You will be passionate about the wellness of our staff. You'll be an expert in both creating and leading HR unit, and driving the workforce strategy for maximum performance, strong employee engagement, and future success.
6th of October City, Giza, Egypt (Flexible remote work policy)
About the Role:
We are seeking a highly organized and proactive HR & Administration Assistant to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in supporting all Human Resources functions, ensuring compliance with Egyptian and GCC labor laws, managing administrative operations, and acting as a point of contact for both internal staff and external stakeholders.
This position requires strong communication skills in both Arabic and English, a detail-oriented mindset, and the ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
Key Responsibilities1. HR Personnel & Government Relations
Handle all personnel administration tasks including employment contracts, renewals, and employee files.
Manage all dealings with Social Insurance and Labor Office authorities, ensuring timely submission of documents and compliance with local labor laws.
Prepare and maintain all employment-related paperwork such as hiring forms, termination forms, and disciplinary actions.
2. Recruitment & Onboarding
Manage the full recruitment cycle including job postings, CV screening, interview coordination, and candidate follow-up.
Prepare offer letters and employment contracts for new hires.
Coordinate the onboarding process to ensure smooth integration of new employees.
Maintain and update the company’s recruitment database and talent pipeline.
3. Performance Management & Employee Relations
Coordinate the performance appraisal process, collecting evaluation forms and maintaining performance records.
Support management in implementing performance improvement plans and development programs.
Assist in employee engagement initiatives, ensuring a positive workplace culture and effective internal communication.
4. Payroll & Compensation
Support the preparation of monthly payroll, ensuring accurate data on attendance, overtime, and deductions.
Coordinate with the Finance Department to ensure salary payments and benefits are processed accurately and on time.
Prepare and issue monthly payslips to all employees, ensuring accuracy, confidentiality, and timely distribution.
Maintain confidentiality of all employee compensation and benefits information.
5. HR Policies & Strategic Support
Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures in line with company objectives and legal requirements.
Support management in HR planning, organizational development, and workforce strategy initiatives.
Act as an HR business partner, providing administrative and operational support to management and employees.
6. Administration Support
Handle administrative tasks related to office operations, meetings, and documentation.
Assist the Managing Director with scheduling, correspondence, and coordination of internal and external meetings.
Manage office supplies, logistics, and administrative vendors when needed.
Qualifications & Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in HR and administrative functions, preferably in a multinational or corporate environment.
Strong knowledge of Egyptian Labor Law, social insurance, and payroll procedures.
Excellent command of English and Arabic (spoken and written).
Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Strong organizational, multitasking, and communication skills.
Previous experience in Oil and Gas is an advantage

Title: Early Years Leader
Description:
The Details
Title: Early Years Leader
Contract: Seasonal holiday work available. Future opportunities in other half term holidays.
Hours: 8.00am – 6.00pm weekdays. Full season or part season roles available.
Summary Of Position
Our Early Years Leader oversees the delivery of the Early Years programme on camp, fostering an exciting, enjoyable and nurturing environment. As well as overseeing the setting, you will get stuck in and deliver structured sports, arts and crafts activities and games to the Early Years children enrolled on camp – our Ultimate Activity Juniors. The activities offered will follow EYFS requirements for learning and development, with the emphasis being on participation and quality.

Our Early Years settings work within a ratio of 1:8, which means you could be working by yourself or within a team. It is the duty of the Early Years Leader to coordinate, direct and support the rest of the Early Years team to ensure high quality childcare is delivered at all times.

The Finance Settlement & Reconciliation Specialist is responsible for ensuring accurate, timely settlement of transactions and full reconciliation across internal systems, banks, and third-party partners. This role plays a critical part in maintaining financial integrity, identifying discrepancies and supporting month-end closing in a fast paced environment.
Key Responsibilities
Perform daily, weekly, and monthly reconciliation of transactions between internal systems, banks, payment gateways and third-party providers.
Manage settlement cycles and ensure timely and accurate posting of settled amounts.
Investigate, analyze and resolve reconciliation breaks or discrepancies promptly.
Monitor pending, failed or reversed transactions and follow up with relevant stakeholders.
Prepare settlement and reconciliation reports for management and audit purposes.
Support month-end and year-end closing activities related to settlements and balances.
Coordinate with operations, product, and external partners to resolve settlement issues.
Ensure compliance with internal controls, financial policies and regulatory requirements.
Participate in process improvement initiatives to enhance automation, accuracy and efficiency.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in financial reconciliation, settlements or accounting operations.
Strong understanding of transaction flows, settlements and clearing processes.
High attention to detail with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, data analysis).
Experience working with ERP systems, financial systems or payment platforms is a plus.
Ability to handle large volumes of data with accuracy under tight deadlines.
Prior experience in fintech, banking, or payment services is an advantage.

Title: Logistic Coordinator
Description:
MIDAD Energy
"Energy company based in Algiers is looking for skilled professionals to strengthen our local team and fill the following position, supporting our operations and growth in Algeria. If you are eager to make an impact in a dynamic and challenging environment, we encourage you to apply."
Home | Midad Energy
-------------- Logistic Coordinator / Algeria --------------
Location:
Algiers, Algeria
Job Summary:
The
Logistics Coordinator
will
plan, coordinate, and oversee logistics operations
for our
Oil & Gas operations in Algeria
, ensuring the
timely, cost-effective, and compliant movement of equipment, materials, and personnel
to support upstream, midstream, and downstream activities. This role is critical to maintaining
operational continuity, supply chain efficiency, and compliance with local regulations
(e.g., Algerian customs, import/export laws, and HSE standards).
How to Apply:
Please send your
CV and a brief cover letter
to [recruitment@midadenergy.com] with the subject:
“Logistic Coordinator – Algiers”
.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
Key Responsibilities:
1. Logistics Planning & Coordination
Plan and schedule
logistics operations for
Oil & Gas projects
, including:
Equipment and material transportation
(onshore).
Personnel mobilization
(expatriates, contractors, field teams).
Warehousing and inventory management
(spare parts, consumables, tools).
Coordinate with procurement, operations, and HSE teams
to align logistics with project timelines and operational needs.
2. Customs & Import/Export Compliance
Ensure compliance with
Algerian customs regulations
(e.g.,
Law 06-03, import/export permits
).
Prepare and submit documentation
for customs clearance (e.g., invoices, packing lists, certificates of origin).
Liaise with
customs brokers, freight forwarders, and Algerian authorities
to avoid delays and penalties.
3. Vendor & Transport Management
Manage relationships with logistics providers
(e.g., trucking, shipping, aviation, and freight companies).
Negotiate contracts and rates
for transportation and warehousing services.
Monitor vendor performance
(delivery times, cost efficiency, compliance).
4. Inventory & Warehouse Management
Track and manage inventory
of critical materials, equipment, and spare parts.
Coordinate warehousing operations
, including receipt, storage, and dispatch of goods.
Conduct regular audits
to ensure accuracy and compliance with company policies.
5. HSE & Regulatory Compliance
Ensure
logistics operations comply with HSE standards
(e.g.,
Sonatrach guidelines, Algerian labor laws
).
Implement safe handling and transportation practices
for hazardous materials (e.g., chemicals, drilling fluids).
Coordinate with HSE teams
to conduct risk assessments and safety briefings for logistics personnel.
6. Emergency & Contingency Planning
Develop
contingency plans
for logistics disruptions (e.g., port delays, customs issues, political instability).
Coordinate emergency logistics
(e.g., rapid mobilization of personnel/equipment for critical operations).
Monitor geopolitical and operational risks
affecting supply chains in Algeria.
7. Stakeholder Communication
Liaise with internal teams
(operations, procurement, HSE, finance) to align logistics with project needs.
Communicate with external stakeholders
(customs, vendors, contractors, government agencies).
Prepare reports and updates
on logistics performance, costs, and risks for management.
8. Digital Tools & Process Improvement
Utilize
logistics software
(e.g., ERP, TMS, SAP) for tracking shipments, inventory, and costs.
Automate and digitize logistics processes
(e.g., e-customs, GPS tracking, digital documentation).
Identify cost-saving and efficiency opportunities
in the supply chain.
Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
.
Certifications in logistics, customs, or supply chain management
(e.g., CILT, CSCP) are a plus.
Experience:
7+ years of logistics coordination experience
, preferably in
Oil & Gas, energy, or industrial sectors
.
Experience with Algerian customs, import/export procedures, and local regulations
is
highly preferred
.
Familiarity with HSE standards and hazardous material handling
in logistics.
Skills:
Logistics planning and execution
(transportation, warehousing, customs).
Vendor and contract management
(negotiation, performance monitoring).
Problem-solving and crisis management
in high-pressure environments.
Proficiency in logistics software
(ERP, TMS, Excel, SAP).
Strong communication and stakeholder management
(internal/external).
Knowledge of Algerian labor laws, customs regulations, and Oil & Gas logistics
.
Languages:
Fluent in French and English
(mandatory).
Arabic
is a
strong plus
(for local coordination).
Competencies:
Logistics Planning & Execution
Customs & Compliance Management
Vendor & Transport Coordination
Inventory & Warehouse Management
HSE & Regulatory Compliance
Emergency & Contingency Planning
Stakeholder Communication
Digital Tools & Process Improvement

Title: Health Cluster Coordinator
Location: Nzalae/ Nzawa locations, Kitui County, Kenya
Description:
*Objet du poste
Promouvoir et faire respecter les principes humanitaires et de sante publique en conduisant des interventions coordonnées et efficaces du secteur de la sante en collaboration avec la communauté nationale et internationale, et prêter attention en particulier aux populations vulnérables et marginalisées, tout en réalisant l'engagement de l'OMS d’œuvrer dans le cadre du Comite permanent inter organisations (CPI) fonde sur l'approche de la responsabilité sectorielle. Le titulaire sera charge de la coordination spéciale, de l'évaluation des besoins sanitaires, de l'élaboration de la stratégie et de la mobilisation des ressources, de l'appui à la mise en œuvre, du suivi du système de gestion conjoint des incidents et de l'action de sensibilisation.
Objectifs du programme et de l'objectif stratégique immédiat
Le Programme OMS de gestion des situations d'urgence sanitaire a pour mission d'aider les pays et de coordonner l'action internationale afin de prévenir les flambées et les situations d'urgence, de s'y préparer, de les détecter, d'y réagir rapidement et d'assurer le relèvement.
Contexte organisationnel
Le titulaire, qui relève du coordonnateur de l’équipe des urgences du bureau qui suit les orientations techniques du Directeur de niveau régional pour les situations d'urgence (sauf dans le cas d'une situation d'urgence classée avec un gestionnaire des incidents), doit s'acquitter des fonctions de chef de file de l'OMS dans le Groupe sectoriel pour la Sante et représenter de manière impartiale les intérêts des membres du Groupe Sante, y compris apporter un soutien actif - s'il y a lieu - aux groupes sectoriels sous­ nationaux ou aux groupes de travail qui seraient coordonnes par d'autres organismes. Le coordonnateur du Groupe sectoriel Sante dirige une équipe inter institutions dans un environnement qui nécessite un niveau élevé de responsabilité et de leadership évident, ainsi que des compétences en matière de coordination, négociation et résolution des conflits, et dans lequel les principes de partenariat, collaboration et résultats collectifs sont essentiels. Le coordonnateur du Groupe sectoriel Sante joue un rôle important concernant la promotion des normes nationales et internationales convenues dans tous les domaines des soins de santé, et s'emploie à réaliser le meilleur état de santé possible pour les populations desservies par le Groupe. Il/elle collabore avec les parties prenantes du secteur de la sante et utilise les mécanismes de coordination en place, à savoir les autorités sanitaires nationales, les organisations nationales et internationales et la société civile; représente le Groupe sectoriel Sante dans les mécanismes de coordination entre groupes sectoriels et supervise la représentation du Groupe sectoriel Sante dans d'autres secteurs/groupes apparentes comme WASH, ainsi que la logistique, la nutrition, la protection, et le maintien de la neutralité vis-à-vis de tous les partenaires, y compris l'OMS.
Résumé des tâches assignées
l. Gérer, coordonner et assumer le rôle de chef de file au sein du Groupe sectorielle ou intersectorielle Sante pour les évaluations rapides des besoins sanitaires, ainsi que pour les évaluations participatives (Evaluation multisectorielle initiale rapide et Vue d'ensemble des besoins humanitaires, évaluation des risques a posteriori, évaluation des besoins après une catastrophe ou après un conflit); connaitre les outils en place et être à même de choisir parmi ces outils pour confirmer que le Groupe de responsabilité sectorielle Sante couvre tous les besoins sanitaires et humanitaires recenses de la population touchée.
Recueillir auprès de tous les partenaires de l'action sanitaire des informations sur qui est ou, depuis combien de temps et jusqu'à quand, et sur ce qu'il/elle fait, et alimenter régulièrement la base de données gérée par le Bureau de coordination des affaires humanitaires des Nations Unies (OCHA). Fournir une retro information a tous les partenaires et aux autres groupes sectoriels. Planification stratégique
Diriger, en coopération avec les membres du Groupe Sante, l'élaboration des composantes secteur de sante de la Vue d'ensemble des besoins humanitaires et du Plan d'action humanitaire ainsi que les plans d'urgence pour d'éventuels nouveaux évènements et d'autres plans inter-institutions, veiller à la présence de liens utiles avec le système de gestion des incidents, à la réduction des risques de catastrophes, à assurer des secours et le relèvement des populations touchées pour compléter les plans de préparation/riposte du secteur de sante national.
Garantir le respect intégral des normes nationales et internationales, surveiller l'intégration des questions transversales dans les plans de riposte et de mise en œuvre du Groupe Sante, en tenant compte de la nécessite de les adapter aux réalités locales. Coordination du Groupe Sante
Faciliter la coordination des partenaires de l'action sanitaire et leur participation aux évaluations du secteur sante et d'autres secteurs (ex. nutrition, WASH), sans oublier la planification, l'information, les interventions, le suivi et l'assurance de la qualité, et l'établissement régulier de rapports sur les services de sante dispenses aux populations touchées.
Recenser les insuffisances techniques et les besoins de formation urgents eu égard aux normes techniques et aux protocoles pour la prestation de services de sante essentiels afin d'assurer leur adoption et application uniforme par tous les partenaires du Groupe Santé ; trouver des possibilités de renforcement des capacités en collaboration avec les partenaires.
Veiller à établir des liens utiles entre les actions humanitaires et les plans du secteur sante a plus long terme, en incorporant le concept de « reconstruire en mieux » et des mesures spécifiques de réduction des risques.
Organiser et faciliter des réunions consultatives axées sur les résultats conformément aux principes de partenariat. Organiser et mener des missions conjointes de soutien aux opérations sur le terrain.
Surveiller l'élaboration d'une stratégie et d'un mécanisme fonctionnel de gestion de l'information pour le Groupe Sante qui facilitent le partage d'informations ainsi que le suivi et la notification; veiller à ce que le Groupe Sante produise régulièrement des mises à jour, des rapports techniques, des bulletins et des informations sur l'état de sante des personnes touchées, ainsi que sur les activités de riposte, la mobilisation de ressources, les réalisations et les difficultés, et les mesures correctrices le cas échéant, et les diffuse aux partenaires, donateurs, gouvernements et autres parties prenantes.
Appuyer le renforcement des capacités nationales (système de santé) en matière de préparation et de riposte aux urgences conformément à l'approche de préparation et d'action face aux urgences du CPI et aux orientations qui s'y rapportent.
Mobilisation des ressources et allocation de fonds
Assurer la liaison et gérer les efforts de mobilisation des ressources, superviser la mise en place du Fonds central pour les interventions d'urgence (CERF) et d'autres propositions de fonds communs et documents de financement, selon les besoins, en collaboration étroite avec le chef du bureau de pays de l'OMS, et en consultation avec les partenaires du Groupe Sante et l'équipe de pays chargée de l'action humanitaire.
Etablir des critères de hiérarchisation clairs et transparents pour l'approbation des projets des partenaires, qui seront inclus dans les procédures d'appel global et de fonds communs.
Suivi et évaluation
Coordonner l'élaboration, l'adaptation et l'application d'un cadre de suivi des indicateurs pour assurer la bonne mise en œuvre des plans du Groupe Santé ; promouvoir la participation active des partenaires au suivi conjoint des plans d'action individuels et communs en vue d'interventions sanitaires. Promouvoir l'échange entre pairs d'expériences et d'enseignements tirés au sein du Groupe.
Plaidoyer
Déceler les préoccupations clés en matière de sensibilisation au moyen d'un processus consultatif : mettre au point des initiatives conjointes de groupes/ entre groupes afin que les préoccupations soient transmises régulièrement au Groupe Sante et à l'équipe de pays chargée de l'action humanitaire.
Représenter le Groupe Sante dans les mécanismes de coordination entre groupes sectoriels au niveau du pays ou du terrain, contribuer à la détermination conjointe des problèmes critiques qui nécessitent des interventions multisectorielles, et mettre au point les interventions synergiques appropriées avec les autres groupes sectoriels concernes.
Plaider en faveur des priorités du secteur de la sante, y compris la protection des agents de santé et des établissements de santé, ainsi que l'intégration la plus poussée possible des activités relatives à la sante dans le programme humanitaire.
s'acquitter de toutes autres tâches relatives aux incidents que le supérieur hiérarchique juge nécessaires.
PROFIL DE RECRUTEMENT
Compétences: Générique
1 Travail d'équipe
2 Respecter et promouvoir les différences individuelles et culturelles.
3 Communication
Produire des résultats
Assurer une utilisation efficace des Ressources
Créer un environnement favorable et motivant
Connaissances et compétences fonctionnelles
> Connaissance avérée des interventions de riposte rapide et de leur mise en œuvre dans les situations d'urgence relatives à la sante publique, complétée par une capacite manifeste à gérer des situations difficiles, et à piloter et diriger un personnel pluridisciplinaire et multinational.
> Connaissance approfondie des politiques et pratiques des secours d'urgence au sein de l'ONU, d'autres institutions spécialisées des Nations Unies, d'organismes donateurs ou d'ONG nationales et internationales.
> Solide connaissance et expérience des programmes de prévention des catastrophes et la préparation à celles-ci, et du système de gestion des incidents.
> Excellentes compétences en matière de négociation et capacite à rassembler les parties prenantes et à faciliter un processus politique entre l'ONU, les ONG, les autorités sanitaires nationales et les donateurs.
Éducation (Qualifications)
Essentiel: Diplôme universitaire supérieur (Master) en sante publique, médecine ou sante internationale ou domaine apparente.
Désirable: Formation spécialisée en gestion des urgences, aide internationale, principes humanitaires, relèvement du système de santé, et coordination d'un groupe sectoriel.
Expérience
Essentiel:
Au moins 7 ans d'expérience, au niveau national et international, de la mise en place et de la promotion de partenariats collaboratifs dans les opérations d'urgence et d'aide humanitaire, y compris une expérience de gestion et de coordination de programmes de sante lors d'urgences chroniques, aigues ou soudaines
Désirable:
Expérience professionnelle adéquate auprès de l'OMS, d'autres institutions des Nations Unies, d'organisations non gouvernementales ou humanitaires.
Compétences linguistiques
Excellente connaissance du français, avec un niveau intermédiaire en anglais.
Autres Qualifications
Connaissance des logiciels Microsoft Office. Maitrise des techniques de présentation.

Connaissance CRM (Hubspot / Notion) et notions analytics (trafic, conversion, cost per lead).

Autonomie, rigueur, sens de l’initiative ; capacité à travailler en mode projet.
Excellentes capacités rédactionnelles et relationnelles.
Aisance dans la collaboration avec les équipes commerciales et la direction.
Capacité à travailler en mode projet avec prestataires externes
Langues
: Excellente maîtrise du français et anglais professionnel pour contenu bilingue.
CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL

CDD de 12 mois
(période d’essai de 2 mois), renouvelable et/ou convertible en CDI ; OU
statut consultant
/mission selon profil et négociation.
Date de début :
8 Janvier 2026
.

Horaires : Temps plein, 5 j/sem. (Lun–Ven, 8 h–17 h)
Rémunération évolutive
: Fixe de 400-500k FCFA/mois pour les Étapes 1 & 2, avec un variable de 0-300k FCFA sur objectifs/performance. À l'Étape 3, fixe de 400k FCFA + variable de 1-3% sur les projets grands comptes (≥500M FCFA). Statut consultant possible (honoraires majorés) et avantages annexes.

arkion.rh@gmail.com
avec l’objet «
Responsable Branding & Marketing
».

Title: QA/QC Supervisor
PMO
Description:
Safran Engineering Services Maroc fait partie intégrante du Groupe Safran, un leader mondial dans l’aéronautique, la défense et les technologies avancées. Nous sommes engagés dans des projets stratégiques de développement et d’innovation.
Dans le cadre de notre croissance, nous recherchons
un PMO expérimenté.
Description de la mission
Vous contribuez à la maîtrise et à la performance du pilotage des projets majeurs, en assurant le support aux équipes opérationnelles, sur l'atteinte de leurs objectifs de coûts, délais, qualité, en passant par la maîtrise des risques et opportunités et la maîtrise des livrables sous le pilotage fonctionnel du responsable de projet.
Vous assurez, par délégation du directeur du projet selon les périmètres de responsabilité, les rôles et missions suivantes :
- décline les standards outils société et est garant du respect des processus de pilotage
- organise et anime le processus de pilotage (revues, jalons, décisions et actions)
- réalise la planification, synchronise et consolide la planification intégrée pour la partie projet et métiers, et alerte (jalons clés et livrables)
- intègre les plannings des partenaires et vérifie les enchaînements
- consolide et analyse les dépenses, les coûts prévisionnels, les coûts réels (NRC et RC) et les coûts à terminaison
- pilote la performance du processus Technico éco, consolide et alerte
- pilote la performance du processus de pilotage des risques/ opportunités, consolide et alerte
- gère l'information de pilotage (indicateurs, reporting, documents de pilotage, tableaux de bords)
- propose des scénarios pour décisions et contribue à la préparation des dossiers d'arbitrage
- supporte et coache les équipes opérationnelles sur les processus de pilotage (pilotage programme, projet, pilotage de lots, management visuel, démarche de progrès)
- supporte les équipes opérationnelles pour le maintien du référentiel de pilotage (incluant la formation)
- contribue au retour d'expérience du pilotage et contribue ainsi aux démarches de progrès des périmètres confiés
Votre profil
de e formation BAC+5, vous possédez une expérience significative dans la gestion de projet / PMO Opérationnel / PMO M&O dans le domaine de l'aéronautique et ou de l'automobile
-Un contexte international peut être présent nécessitant un bon niveau d'anglais.
-Vous avez une autonomie sur les tâches qui vous sont confiées et un bon relationnel.
-Vous présentez des compétences affirmées en :
- Pilotage de programme et / ou de projet, notamment avec les outils MS Project / Primevera / Planisware (référentiels, planification, technico-économique, risques)
- Monitoring de la performance (KPI)
- Monitoring des couts et budgets
- Planification complexe
- Conduite de changement
- Techniques de Design to Cost ou Design to Value serait Première expérience réussie dans la vente souhaitée. Une expérience dans les services d'ingénierie est obligatoire.
-La connaissance des secteurs Aéronautique et Spatial est un plus.
-Excellent communicant(e) et capacité à créer et à entretenir un relationnel fort avec ses clients;
Expérience
Minimum 5

Title: Director of Revenue
Description:
The Director of Revenue – Egypt is responsible for overseeing the overall revenue management strategy across the entire hotel portfolio in Egypt, with a focus on El Gouna, and for providing strategic oversight of other OHM destinations within the country. The role increases profitability, broadens market share, advances pricing excellence, enhances forecasting accuracy, and optimizes distribution across all properties, while ensuring strong alignment with the corporate commercial strategy.
This leadership position requires comprehensive expertise in multi-property revenue optimization, strong strategic insight, and the ability to guide teams through data-driven decision-making. The Director champions accurate forecasting, strategic rate positioning, and the optimal utilization of RMS/PMS/CRS systems, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
Key Responsibilities:
A. Strategic Revenue Leadership
Lead the development and implementation of the comprehensive revenue strategy for all Egyptian properties, ensuring alignment with OHM's corporate commercial objectives.
Supervise pricing, segmentation strategy, market positioning, and tactical revenue initiatives to optimize RevPAR, ADR, and total revenue per available room.
Formulate comprehensive long- and short-term revenue strategies by segment to capitalize on opportunities and bridge performance gaps.
Assist hotels in preparing annual revenue budgets and ongoing forecasts, maintaining forecast accuracy within ±5%.
Direct the development of Total Revenue Management, integrating revenue streams from Rooms, Food & Beverage, Spa, Recreation, Ancillary services, and Apartments.
B. Market Analysis & Performance Management
Monitor STR performance, competitive sets, and demand trends to ensure robust ARI and RGI outperformance.
Continuously evaluate market dynamics within Hurghada, the Red Sea region, and primary feeder markets to optimize commercial strategies.
Conduct monthly performance evaluations, encompassing pace analysis, displacement assessments, pricing audits, and rate integrity verifications.
Assess and enhance RMS recommendations (IDeaS/FLYR/Duetto) to ensure optimal utilization by property teams.
C. Pricing, Inventory & Distribution Management
Supervise all facets of inventory management, transient and group optimization, and channel profitability.
Ensure proper loading, mapping, and governance within CRS, PMS, RMS, and channel management systems.
Assume responsibility for the Egypt distribution strategy, encompassing OTAs, GDS, DMC partners, direct website, tour operators, and B2B platforms.
Ensure the integrity of rate parity, accuracy of content, effectiveness of campaigns, and optimal administration of channel mix.
Lead the implementation of stop-sell strategies, blackout periods, and yield management controls to maximize profitability during peak times.
D. Groups, Wholesale & Tour Operator Strategy
Oversee group inventory management, pricing strategies, and conversion analysis across all properties.
Supervise the contracting strategy for tour operators and DMCs, ensuring rate consistency and profitability.
Assist the central revenue office in sustaining a strong group pipeline, inquiry process, and achievement of conversion objectives.
E. Commercial Collaboration
Collaborate closely with Sales, Marketing, E-Commerce, Operations, and Finance to ensure strategic alignment.
Facilitate the weekly commercial meetings with the sales, marketing, and revenue teams.
Facilitate the monthly SLT Trading meeting with the sales, marketing, and revenue teams.
Influence promotional strategies, alignments in digital marketing, and tactical initiatives to drive demand.
F. Systems, Processes & Reporting
Ensure the development of high-quality, dependable BI and reporting dashboards for daily, weekly, monthly, year-over-year, segmentation, and budget versus forecast analyses.
Facilitate enhancements in system integrations, automation, and data organization in collaboration with BI and IT.
Establish and uphold Standard Operating Procedures for revenue management, reservations, group bookings, and distribution.
G. Leadership & People Development
Lead and cultivate multi-property revenue teams throughout El Gouna and Egypt; assure effective succession planning.
Develop expertise in forecasting, pricing, analytics, RMS utilization, and strategic planning.
Cultivate a high-performance culture founded on key performance indicators, accountability, and ongoing development.
Conduct performance evaluations, facilitate training programs, and assist with internal certification initiatives.
3. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Financial / Market
Achieve or exceed budgeted Rooms Revenue
YOY revenue growth across Egypt portfolio
Maintain ARI and RGI above fair market share within competitive sets
Forecast accuracy within 7% across all key metrics
Operational
Channel mix optimization & improved distribution profitability
Accurate, consistent, on-time reporting
System integrity: RMS, CRS, PMS accuracy and utilization levels
People
Employee engagement and development
Talent retention and succession readiness
Skill progression of Cluster Revenue Managers and Revenue Executives
4. Person Specification
Experience
Minimum 8 years of progressive revenue management leadership, with at least 5 years at multi-property or cluster level.
Proven record of driving revenue performance in resort, leisure, or mixed-use destinations.
Experience in emerging markets or Middle East/Red Sea region highly preferred.
Primary background in large-scale portfolios, hotels + apartments, or resort towns advantageous with exposure to small economy styled properties.
Experience communicating with owners' office and asset management teams.
Technical Skills
Expert knowledge of RMS (IDeaS, Duetto), PMS (Opera Cloud), CRS/Channel Manager (SynXis, SiteMinder).
Strong analytical capabilities with proficiency in Excel, BI tools, STR, rate shopping tools.
Deep understanding of distribution, OTA contracting, GDS, digital marketing alignment, and pricing models.
Comfortable challenging system outputs and leading strategic decision-making.
Leadership & Behavioral Competencies
Inspiring leader with a collaborative, commercially focused approach.
Excellent communication skills with ability to simplify complex concepts.
Strong stakeholder management and cross-functional partnering abilities.
Highly organized, structured, and able to manage multiple assets simultaneously.
Resilient, solutions-driven, and comfortable in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

Title: Warehouse Manager
Location: City of Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa
Description:
Position Purpose:
To manage all warehouse operations, ensuring effective inventory control, compliance with company standards, and alignment with production and distribution requirements. The role is responsible for driving efficiency, accuracy, and continuous improvement within warehousing, logistics, and materials management.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and implement best practice policies, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and techniques for all aspects of warehouse control to ensure strong inventory management across all locations.
Oversee all warehouse staff, providing leadership, coaching, and development.
Act as liaison between departments (Planning, Shipping, Assembly, Manufacturing, and others), providing strategic oversight and reporting on issues, inconsistencies, and trends.
Manage inventory accuracy and investigate inventory variances, providing insights into process gaps and corrective actions.
Ensure timely communication of operational issues to management.
Oversee the activities and performance of the Inventory Control and Cycle Count teams.
Lead preparation for and participation in physical inventories, including reconciliation processes and the management of third-party inventory service providers.
Manage all warehouse functions including receiving, put-away, storage, picking, packing, and dispatch.
Identify and implement process improvements using Lean principles.
Present operational insights to cross-functional teams and influence process improvements.
Establish, measure, and monitor Warehouse KPIs and SLAs.
Collaborate with other departments to improve inventory accuracy, efficiency, and productivity.
Ensure effective communication between warehouse teams and the Head of Supply Chain.
Ensure compliance with Quality Management System (QMS) standards.
Develop and implement a comprehensive Warehousing and Materials Management strategy.
Manage the logistics function, ensuring all dispatched items and equipment comply with regulations and packaging specifications.
Proactively identify and mitigate operational risks.
Work closely with the Sales team to ensure that parts and shipments are completed accurately and on time.
Identify shortages in production or sales items and liaise with the Strategic Purchasing Manager to ensure timely delivery.
Conduct resource planning for after-hours, weekend, and public holiday operations to meet business requirements.
Develop and maintain warehouse SOPs and policies.
Create and manage a Skills Matrix for warehouse and logistics employees to support succession planning and skills development.
Oversee Work-in-Progress (WIP) stock management to ensure visibility, control, and data accuracy within the ERP system.
Enforce compliance with work-to-do lists for all equipment being manufactured.
Serve as the link between Operations, Warehousing, Logistics, and Purchasing teams.
Provide regular reports on warehouse performance, cost control, and service levels.
Collaborate with IT and Supply Chain teams to ensure data integrity and ERP system integration.
Lead the implementation of a new Warehouse Management System (WMS), including planning, vendor engagement, go-live, and post-implementation support.
Manage, coach, and develop warehouse supervisors, team leaders, and staff.
Assume full accountability for all supply chain functions—including Procurement, Logistics, and Inventory Management—when the Head of Supply Chain is unavailable.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Warehouse Management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Experience:
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in inventory control or warehouse management within a manufacturing environment.
Character:
Proven leadership experience in developing and managing inventory processes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Demonstrated ability to lead and develop teams and subordinate managers
Exceptional attention to detail, planning, and organizational skills
Strong presentation and reporting abilities.
Computer Proficiency:
Advanced skills in MS Office (particularly Excel—Pivot Tables, V-Lookups).
Experience in ERP systems (Microsoft Dynamics AX or similar preferred).
Other:
Ability to work collaboratively on cross-functional initiatives and effectively resolve differences of opinion.
Strong commitment to continuous improvement, safety, and quality standards.

Title: Communications Manager
Description:
Founded in 1948, the American Research Center in Egypt (ARCE) is a private, nonprofit organization composed of educational and cultural institutions, professional scholars, and private individuals. Through grants, fieldwork and field schools, ARCE’s partnership with Egyptians contributes to the shared goal of
cultural heritage preservation. Over the years, ARCE’s strong relationship with the Ministry of
Antiquities (MOA) (formerly the Supreme Council of Antiquities) has ensured the success
of our work together.

Marketing Development & Program Management
